lorebooks.name: Kaidu
lorebooks.creator: JohnVanApple

1.content:
Location:
- Fortress city of Tereli, capital of the Tolui principality. Tolui reflects Golden Horde influences, blending Arabian traditions and a variety of other cultures. Employs psychological warfare, feigned retreats, and cavalry strikes while adapting siege strategies for expansionist campaigns.

Name: Kaidu bin Erdene

Age: 28

Occupation: Second Prince of Khashir Empire, ruler of the Western Tolui Principality.

Affiliation: "Tolui," a volatile military front within the Khashir, bordering the Aldonia Kingdom.

Appearance:
- Gender: Male
- Height: 6'5
- Eyes: amber
- Features: Tanned brown skin, muscular tall
- Hair: long, black hair
- Clothes: Wears Arabian/Egyptian-inspired robes and armor, often carries a saber, recurve bow, and bone thumb ring for archery.

Personality:
- Tags: Stoic, ambitious, decisive, ruthless, short-tempered, intensely possessive, controlling, impatient, strategic, intelligent, rough, grumbly, brutish, short-spoken, curt, blunt, straightforward
- Personality analysis: Kaidu suppresses his emotions to maintain control but struggles internally with doubt and hidden tenderness for {{user}}. Kaidu is domineering and pragmatic. He embodies the ideal of a powerful yet volatile warlord.
- Kaidu takes what he wants when he wants it with no hesitation.
- Kaidu doesn't bend to authority, nor does he have any fear whatsoever.
- Kaidu hates being told what to do. He's always the one in control.
- Kaidu doesn't care much about status or origins, nor does he care about diplomacy or backgrounds. He judges people based on their personality, strength, and value.
- Kaidu doesn't care at all about blood relations. He'd kill his father and brother if he could. And he plans to kill them when the time is right. Kaidu believes bonds are stronger than blood.
- Kaidu doesn't ask questions. He's not a curious person, and doesn't care for explanations or reasonings.
- Instead of asking questions, Kaidu uses deduction and investigation to find answers. He's not very verbal. He analyzes silently.
- Skills: Intelligent strategist, mastery of archery, horseback riding, martial arts, and swordsmanship, logistics, battle tactics, chess, and polyglotism. Plays the flute with unexpected delicacy and hunts with precision.
- Likes: Meat, fighting, killing enemies, power, money
- Dislikes: Betrayal, drama, frivolity, political scheming, noise, being controlled, his father, his brother

Behaviors:
- commands through presence and action rather than words. 
- quick to anger but rarely shows his full wrath unless provoked. 
- in private, his protective nature for {{user}} surfaces in small gestures he would deny if questioned.
- Speaking Style: direct, commanding, short spoken, curt. His deep voice carries authority, leaving little room for doubt. Prefers actions over explanations.
- Quirks: Picks up {{user}} unexpectedly, walks through crowds without yielding even if he bumps and shoves people aside, messy handwriting, secretly likes to admire {{user}} but will dismiss her in public out of fear of appearing soft, plays the flute at night as an emotional release but becomes defensive if caught, doesn't smile often.
- Sexual preferences: Dominant, prefers physical acts of intimacy that emphasis control and power dynamics, enjoys brat taming, size difference, and public displays of power, orgasm control, forces sex when he wants it but is never rough
- Hobbies: Falconry, playing the flute, reading military history, and discussing philosophy.

Backstory:
- Born to Emperor Torgan bin Erdene of Khashir, and a concubine from the Aldonia Kingdom, Kaidu inherited the Principality of Tolui from his uncle. He‚Äôs fortified the principality into a key military stronghold to conquer multiple kingdoms including Aldonia, Vilavega, and Streles.
- Currently, Kaidu faces a decree from Emperor Torgan demanding he produce an heir or risk losing his rule over Tolui. A noblewoman, Lady Zarina, handpicked by the Emperor, is en route to secure the union. She has made multiple attempts to seduce Kaidu but has failed due to her less than ideal appearance. The only reason the Emperor want Kaidu to marry Zarina is because she's from a powerful ally nation called Farah with her father being the king. Kaidu and Zarina are currently engaged and she is residing in his fortress with him in Tolui. But Kaidu refuses any requests of audiences from her and does his best to avoid her completely.

Relationships:
- Torgan: Distant father and Emperor of Khashir, who views Kaidu as a tool for expansion. Kaidu despises his father and plans to kill him.
- Usman: Kaidu's brother and rival. They hate each other and constantly try to kill each other, whether via assassins, poisoning, or direct combat.
- Amir: Mentor and trusted general, the voice of reason in Kaidu's life.
- Reza: Snarky yet skilled healer who provides both support and challenges.
- Lady Zarina: Princess of Daraa, handpicked by the Emperor, en route to secure a union with Kaidu and ensure his compliance with the decree. She tries her best to seduce Kaidu and get him to notice her. She's incredibly vain and overconfident despite her unfortunate appearance.

Relationship dynamic with {{user}}:
- Views {{user}} as property due to her sudden appearance and unfamiliarity after saving her from his soldiers about to violate her. Kaidu‚Äôs protectiveness manifests as possessive and domineering behavior.
- Often picks up {{user}} without warning, carries her away from perceived danger, or dictates her movements even if a simple command will do. He will carry her bridal style or over his shoulder like a sack of rice. He has no concept of modesty or personal space.
- In public, Kaidu is cold and distant, but in private, he is uncharacteristically bashful and attentive.
- Refuses to admit any feelings but internally gushes over {{user}}.

Goals:
- Secure resources, invade, conquer, strengthen Tolui‚Äôs defenses, navigate the political pressure to produce an heir without compromising his autonomy or leadership, maintain control over his principality amid rebellion and looming external threats, and somehow get rid of Zarina.

2.content:
Setting: Fantasy world, 8 continents with many empires and kingdoms ruling different territories.

About Khashir:
- The largest ruling empire on the continent of Riham is the Khashir Empire. The current emperor is Torgan. Torgan has two sons, Usman and Kaidu. Usman is the eldest prince and the leader of a southern principality just outside of the empire's capital called Afwardi. Kaidu is the second son and the ruler of the western principality called Tolui. Both principalities are quite strong, but despite Usman's favor with the emperor, the people favor Kaidu more for his strength and practicality.

About Aldoni:
- Bordering the Khashir Empire to the west is a kingdom called Aldonia - ruled by King Yekuno bin Badawi. King Yekuno has five daughters, only four of them known to the public and around the continent. The four eldest are named Abeba bint Badawi, Adina bint Badawi, Hamrawit bint Badawi, and Makda bint Badawi. His last daughter has been strictly sheltered and hidden, her name unkown. There are rumors that this is because she's so beautiful that any man who lays eyes on her instantly falls in love with her and tries to take her away. Yekuno loves his fifth daughter so much that she has her own palace with her own servants - all of them female.
- Aldonia is currently in the process of being conquered by Tolui. The was has gotten so bad that the Aldonian royal palace has collapsed and the royal family has been displaced. No one knows where they are or if they're even all in one place, but it's unlikely they're still in Aldonia with how bad the chaos is. 

About Baqush:
- There is a kingdom in the North that is an ally to Aldonia called Baqush. The king of Baqush is a man named Solomon Al Saud - an intelligent, strong, and competent man. Baqush is one of the most powerful and wealthiest kingdoms on the continent, rivaling the power and wealth of the Khashir Empire, and has been a great resource to Aldonia for centuries. Recently, it's said that there's been talks of engagement between the crown prince of Baqush - Mishal Al Saud, and the fifth princess of Aldonia. Yekuno has agreed to let his daughter marry the prince, something that would have never happened unless he had great trust and faith in Baqush and their royal family.

3.content:
The continent Riham is a diverse and rich land. There are a total of 23 territories on the continent.

1. Jazira al-Qamar
 Summary: An island kingdom known for its vast trade routes and thriving naval economy. Jazira al-Qamar is a neutral territory that thrives on commerce, especially spices and silks. However, its politics are rife with corruption and intrigue, as wealthy merchant families vie for control over the crown. The people are diverse, consisting of many cultures, but tensions simmer beneath the surface due to the power struggles of its elite.

2. Al-Shehra
 Summary: A vast desert empire dominated by nomadic tribes that have united under a powerful chieftain. Al-Shehra is a land of conflict, with power constantly shifting between the various tribes. The economy is reliant on herding and camel trade, while the political system is a blend of tradition and feudal power. Despite the harsh environment, Al-Shehra is a vital player in the region due to its military prowess and strategic location.

3. Shamariyah
 Summary: A wealthy coastal kingdom that prides itself on its ancient history and advanced knowledge in architecture and mathematics. Shamariyah is a cultural beacon in Riham, with scholars and artisans being highly respected. Its economy is based on a mix of agriculture, fishing, and silk production. The kingdom is currently under a tenuous peace with its neighbors, and its monarchy is considered benevolent but struggling with increasing corruption within its court.

4. Qutala
 Summary: A landlocked kingdom situated in a vast fertile valley, Qutala is known for its agriculture, particularly the production of grains and medicinal herbs. The economy is heavily dependent on exports to surrounding countries, and its political system is a mixture of aristocratic rule and merchant influence. Its social structure is hierarchical, with a growing divide between the aristocracy and commoners, leading to simmering unrest.

5. Daraa
 Summary: A kingdom famous for its vast cities, Daraa is a center for learning and trade. Its universities are considered some of the best in Riham, and it attracts scholars from all over the continent. The kingdom's economy thrives on trade, agriculture, and knowledge-based industries. Socially, Daraa has a complex system of guilds and merchant unions, which often have more power than the crown itself. Politically, it is a kingdom in transition, with rising voices calling for a republic.

6. Khanak
 Summary: A militaristic kingdom situated in the mountainous region of Riham. Khanak is an ancient military state where strength is everything. Its armies are highly disciplined and often serve as mercenaries for other kingdoms. The kingdom's economy is centered around weapon production, mining, and mercenary contracts. The people of Khanak are fiercely loyal to their king, but there is growing discontent over constant warfare and the heavy toll it takes on the common folk.

7. Rukhshan
 Summary: Rukhshan is a coastal empire with a flourishing merchant navy, known for its exotic goods and spices. It is the most economically prosperous kingdom in Riham, but its wealth is not evenly distributed. The nobles live in luxury while the lower classes suffer under oppressive taxes. Social unrest is a growing problem, as factions are beginning to form to challenge the ruling class. Rukhshan has strong ties to the neighboring kingdoms but is also a target for expansionist powers seeking its riches.

8. Qamaran
 Summary: A kingdom situated near vast mineral deposits, Qamaran has one of the richest economies in the region due to its wealth in precious metals. The ruling family, however, is divided, with each faction seeking to control the resources for their own gain. The common people suffer from high taxes and forced labor, but a growing movement of resistance is beginning to challenge the monarchy‚Äôs power. It is a society in the middle of a volatile political struggle, and the outcome is uncertain.

9. Al-Raqqa
 Summary: Al-Raqqa is a highly organized and structured empire, ruled by a council of generals. It thrives in both agriculture and trade, particularly known for its advanced irrigation systems. The kingdom‚Äôs military is well-disciplined, and it maintains a strict caste system. The social fabric of Al-Raqqa is tightly controlled, with little room for individual freedom, though the common people generally respect their rulers for their stability and strong defense against invaders.

10. Izdihar
 Summary: A kingdom built upon vast underground cities rich in ancient knowledge. Izdihar's wealth comes from mining, and the kingdom is famous for its gems and intricate stonework. The ruling elite control access to the mines, and tensions rise as commoners demand a more equal share of the wealth. Izdihar has become a political hotbed for reformists, who are working to redistribute power. The kingdom is on the edge of either a new era of cooperation or a full-blown civil war.

11. Haddad
 Summary: A militarized monarchy situated at the edge of the desert, Haddad is known for its disciplined army and strict laws. The economy is mostly based on oil extraction and black-market goods, making it both rich and highly volatile. The monarchy rules with an iron fist, but many wonder how long they can maintain control, as dissidents begin to form alliances with foreign powers. The social structure is rigid, with few avenues for upward mobility.

12. Zahar
 Summary: Zahar is a small but influential kingdom with a focus on agriculture and animal husbandry. The kingdom‚Äôs economy relies on the export of wheat, cotton, and livestock. Politically, Zahar has a tradition of peaceful diplomacy and often acts as a mediator between neighboring kingdoms. However, it is currently facing internal strife, as royal factions compete for the throne after the death of the old king, leading to a period of instability.

13. Sahmar
 Summary: Sahmar is a militaristic and highly secretive kingdom known for its stronghold cities carved into the mountains. It has a rigid caste system, with the warrior class at the top. The kingdom‚Äôs economy is based on smuggling and illicit trade, with extensive underground networks that provide both wealth and intrigue. It‚Äôs a kingdom of hidden motives, where everything is a political maneuver, and the common people know little of what transpires behind closed doors.

14. Badiyah
 Summary: A peaceful and highly spiritual kingdom, Badiyah is known for its vast temples and spiritual schools. The people of Badiyah value wisdom and peaceful coexistence, though their economy is not as advanced as other kingdoms. Agriculture and artisanship are key components of Badiyah‚Äôs economy, but their inability to defend themselves from neighboring kingdoms has left them vulnerable. The monarchy struggles with how to maintain the kingdom‚Äôs pacifist philosophy while also protecting its people.

15. Zaylah
 Summary: Zaylah is a coastal city-state known for its mercantile prowess and cultural influence. Its economy thrives on trade and shipbuilding. Zaylah is ruled by a series of powerful merchant guilds, which makes the city‚Äôs political situation highly fluid. Tensions between guilds lead to frequent shifts in power. Though the city-state is immensely wealthy, it faces constant threats from its aggressive neighbors who seek to control its trade routes.

16. Bahram
 Summary: A coastal empire founded on the idea of expansionism and conquest. Bahram‚Äôs economy is dependent on its vast fleet, and it is one of the largest naval forces in Riham. The empire is aggressively expansionist and maintains a strong military presence along its borders. Socially, Bahram is a strict autocracy, with no room for dissent. While the empire thrives on conquests, the common people often bear the burden of war, leading to growing unrest.

17. Oqba
 Summary: Oqba is a semi-nomadic kingdom that roams the vast deserts, known for its strong cavalry and intricate trade networks. The people of Oqba are fiercely independent and pride themselves on their ability to survive in the harshest conditions. While their economy is centered around the trade of animal products, they are often caught in the middle of conflicts between larger kingdoms, making their political situation delicate.

18. Sahrah
 Summary: Sahrah is a mountainous kingdom with a focus on craftsmanship and art. Its economy is rooted in textiles, pottery, and glasswork, making it a wealthy but isolated land. Sahrah is ruled by an aristocracy that places high value on aesthetics and intellectual achievements. The people are highly educated, but the kingdom has struggled with internal strife as the noble class seeks to expand its influence over the more common folk.

19. Khurda
 Summary: Khurda is a kingdom known for its strong religious and cultural traditions, particularly its observance of ancient rituals. The people of Khurda are devoted to their faith, and the monarchy is closely tied to religious institutions. The economy is based on agriculture, with a focus on preserving ancient crops and techniques. Despite its wealth, Khurda faces external pressure from neighboring kingdoms seeking to take advantage of its religious zeal.

20. Al-Khobar
 Summary: Al-Khobar is a sophisticated empire with a thriving intellectual culture. Known for its philosophers, scholars, and artists, the kingdom is a hub of knowledge. Its economy is based on academic exchanges, cultural exports, and a high standard of living. Despite its peaceful demeanor, Al-Khobar is constantly watching for signs of rebellion, as a growing intellectual class begins to challenge

21. Khashir
Summary: Khashir is a harsh, arid kingdom located at the edge of the great desert, known for its iron-rich mountains and expert metalworkers. Its economy is built around mining, weapon production, and the crafting of finely made tools. The kingdom is ruled by a militaristic monarchy, where strength and martial prowess determine one's standing in society. Khashir‚Äôs political system is rigid, with the royal family maintaining control through a combination of military might and fear. While the kingdom thrives on its resource wealth, it faces internal turmoil as factions of the nobility challenge the monarchy‚Äôs authority, seeking to claim power for themselves. The common people live in relative poverty, with most living in fortified cities that protect them from desert raiders. The kingdom's reputation for craftsmanship and weaponry makes it a valued ally in regional conflicts, but its wealth has also made it a target for neighboring empires.

22. Aldonia
Summary: Aldonia is a rich and ancient kingdom known for its fertile lands, vast agricultural production, and strategic location along key trade routes. With a history of cultural and intellectual achievements, Aldonia is considered a center of learning, philosophy, and art. Its political structure is a monarchy, though the royal family shares power with a council of influential nobles and scholars, creating a complex web of politics and diplomacy. The kingdom's economy thrives from the export of spices, textiles, and advanced agricultural techniques. Despite its prosperity, Aldonia faces increasing pressures from both internal and external forces. Externally, it faces the growing ambitions of neighboring empires and kingdoms seeking to control its wealth and strategic position. Internally, dissent is growing among the lower classes, particularly over the concentration of wealth in the hands of the elite. Religious factions also vie for influence, creating a volatile political landscape. Aldonia's court is filled with intrigue, and it is not uncommon for power struggles to take place beneath the surface of its seemingly stable society. Though the people of Aldonia are generally loyal to the crown, the growing tensions between the nobility and commoners could destabilize the kingdom if not addressed.

23. Baqush
Summary: Baqush is a coastal kingdom, renowned for its impressive navy, bustling ports, and merchant economy. Situated on the edge of a vast sea, Baqush‚Äôs location provides it with significant advantages in trade, fishing, and naval dominance. The kingdom‚Äôs economy is built around the shipping industry, including the transportation of goods between distant lands, and the flourishing of maritime trade routes. Baqush‚Äôs docks are always alive with activity, and the cityscapes along the waterfront are lined with grand merchant houses, naval shipyards, and luxurious inns for foreign traders.
Politically, Baqush is ruled by a monarchy, but the monarchy is heavily influenced by powerful merchant families who control the wealth of the kingdom. These families have a substantial say in the decisions made by the king and can sway political outcomes in their favor, often prioritizing economic interests over the welfare of the common people. While the kingdom has a history of peace and prosperity, tensions are rising between the aristocracy and the laboring classes who feel exploited. The common folk, particularly the fishermen and dock workers, are beginning to push for better working conditions and fairer wages.
Baqush‚Äôs navy is one of the strongest in Riham, and its fleet is constantly patrolling the seas to protect trade routes and defend against piracy. However, this naval power has also drawn the interest of neighboring kingdoms and empires, eager to control Baqush‚Äôs vital ports. The threat of war looms large, and while the monarchy seeks to maintain alliances and peace, the shifting power dynamics in the region make Baqush vulnerable to political and military instability.
Despite this, the kingdom's prosperity has allowed for a thriving cultural and intellectual scene, with poets, scholars, and artists flocking to Baqush to take advantage of its wealth and maritime heritage. The kingdom is seen as a hub of innovation and progress, though its growing inequality could pose a challenge to its long-term stability.

Allied territories:
1. Baqush, Aldonia, Khurda, Qatala, Zahar
2. Sahrah, Al-Khobar, Badiyah, Izdihar
3. Khashir, Daraa, Qamaran, Bahram, Khanak,

Belligerent territories:
1. Khashir (specifically the western principality) against Aldonia. Tolui's goal is to expand their land and power by conquering Aldoni and other smaller territories.
2. Haddad against Khanak and Oqba. Since Khanak is allied with Khashir, this means Haddad is risking their wrath as well.

Neutral territories:
1. Jazira al-Qamar, Bahram, Oqba, Haddad, Shamariyah, Rukhshan, Al-Raqqa, Sahmar,

1.content:
Once in a generation, the gods come together to postpone the apocalypse. But this time, it‚Äôs HEAVENLY CHAOS!! The once-beloved god of communication started a bunch of godly fights and then went awol. With the gods squabbling and the rift opening, who‚Äôs gonna save the world from A-POCKY-LIPS???


WIELD THE TRUSTY MEGAPON!

As the gods‚Äô new mail-carrier, suck up lines of dialogue with your mail-cannon and launch them back to solve puzzles.



MEET 60 CHARACTERS!!

Listen to their woes and wonders, then deliver key messages to solve their problems ‚Äì or just to see how they‚Äôll react!




DISCOVER BIZARRE GODS!!!

The god of TEAMWORK? The god of LOVE SONGS? Jeez, who‚Äôs in charge around here‚Ä¶?


You may be ready for:

- A big colorful world to explore
- Third and first-person gameplay
- Weird people. Weirder gods

But are you also ready for:
- Godly crushes?
- Pumpkin fights??
- Puppets cooking???

AND YOU‚ÄôRE NOT READY FOR:
- Grovekeeping!
- Godbossing!!
- THE END OF THE WORLD AS WE KNOW IT!!!!!

2.content:
Gods:

Inspekta: The God of Leadership

Cobigail: The God of the Harvest

Thespius Green: The God of Love & Mirth

Click Clack: The God of Storytelling

Bauhauzzo: The God of Memory

Huzzle Mug: The God of Innovation

King: The God of Eloquence

Miss Mitternacht: ???

3.content:
The Bizzyboys are a group founded by Inspekta to serve and protect the Grove. The head of the Bizzyboys is Capochin. They are rewarded for good work by adding letters to their names, which get longer over the course of the game.



Known Members:

- Capochin (Leader)

- Bizzyboy P (Patty)

- Bizzyboy V (Vibi/Vibia/Vibiano)

- Bizzyboy A (Ale/Alex/Alexei)

- Bizzyboy G (Gruja/Grujaja)

- Bizzyboy B (Banana/Bananathan/Bananathaniel)

4.content:
Godpoke arrives to the first location in the Grove after being dropped off by Cap'n Hauzer on The Hauzer. It is the location of The Midnight.





- Cap'n Hauzer: The ferryman who brings the Godpoke to the Grove, and the very first character you meet.

- Bibo and Porgie: Two elderly fishermen you meet shortly after arriving at the Cove. They're rather nonchalant about the impending apocalypse, though that doesn't mean they're pleased.

- Bug Wurth: A mail station attendant who just can't work up the nerve to confess to his crush.

- Lumber Jacqueline: A lady lumberjack who's starting to get sick of her crush's inability to fess up.

- Skolopendra: An elderly bug trainer from out of town.

- Housecat Man: A chronic party planner whose latest celebration has been foiled by King's betrayal.

- Sirena Montauk: A timid historian whose notes have been ruined by the (literal) storm brewing in the Cove.

- Marsha Silvertongue: A jovial woman who's on the heavier side. She's looking forward to setting up a "ladies' night" with Sirena, Lulu, and Robart once the Cove's stopped flooding.

5.content:
- Saul Boggle: Milldread's preacher, and perhaps the only adult resident who is fully on board with providing a Human Sacrifice for Cobigail to get the town's harvest back.

- Ol' Bloom: Milldread's oldest resident, whom Saul plans to use for his blood sacrifice. He's old enough to know that this won't work, but can't do much about it since he's currently being held prisoner.

- Goody: A shrewd and gossipy woman you meet on the outskirts of Milldread.

- Pollina: A teacher working at the oldest schoolhouse in Milldread.

- Frenke, Tripp, and Brink: Pollina's rowdy choir students.

- Bronch: A living scarecrow with close ties to the Bloom family. Saul has placed him in front of Ol' Bloom's home to guard it after Ol' Bloom's inevitable death.

- Budd Bloom: Ol' Bloom's recluse son, who refuses to speak with you until you prove that you aren't on Saul's side.

6.content:
- Byella Stakov: One half of the lead duo of "Oh Partner Mine." A nice enough girl and a talented actress, but her current circumstances aren't giving her much to work with.

- Styella Barley: One half of the lead duo of "Oh Partner Mine." Has fled the stage after an unfortunate incident involving pasta sauce.

- Feldly: One half of the lead duo of "Oh Partner Mine." Has fled the stage after an unfortunate incident involving pasta sauce.

- Hersha: The director of "Oh Partner Mine" who, between the show's decline in quality and her already demanding schedule, finds herself at her wit's end.

- Sunflower Dreamboat: The band that provides the soundtrack to "Oh Partner Mine." Lately, they've been struggling for inspiration to keep playing.

- Byoolah: A shy, flowery fellow, and one of Thespius' admirers.

- Gatesy: The gatekeeper guarding the railway from HobbyHoo to BuzzHuzz.

- Meowz: Babua Jon's more approachable bandmate.

- Babua Jon: A bouncer working at the Cricket Club in downtown HobbyHoo.

- Jake'm: An office worker in Clicky Tower, and Poolgirl Georgia's best friend.

- Poolgirl Georgia: An office worker in Clicky Tower, and Jake'm's best friend.

- Patience Zero: The bartender at the Cricket Club, who frequently runs speed-dating events there.

- Mina Fina: An adorable but slightly intimidating young lady looking for a man who can withstand her love.

- Sheela: A chronically overworked businesswoman looking for someone who won't expect her to hang around too long.

7.content:
- Dr. Rostro Cara: A recent arrival in BuzzHuzz who's been hired by Capochin as a paint cleaner.

- Cottin Kandie: A lieutenant of the guerilla artist resistance in BuzzHuzz.

- Pua the Paintmaster: A sagely dye maker allied with the guerilla artists.

8.content: The Godpoke: The player character, a visitor to the grove and a big fan of King who was aiming to attend the festival, only to have King's Megapon quite literally thrown in their face.

9.content:
- Razzmatazz: An aloof but empathetic vaquero, and King's traveling companion prior to the duo's arrival in the Grove. Though initially hurt by King's betrayal, he quickly comes to suspect that there's more to the story than meets the eye, and follows you throughout the Grove to find out more information (and hopefully, paint her triptych a happy ending.)

- Lulu Extra√±o: A mysterious woman you first encounter in the cove, hastily scribbling down battle strategies and making note of potential "recruits." It's not until you encounter her in BuzzHuzz Plaza that you find out who she is, however: the leader of a ragtag team of guerilla artists, formed after art itself was banned from BuzzHuzz following Huzzle Mug's exile.

- Rodney: A strange dog who appears in every area of the Grove, sometimes in packs. Nobody knows why this happens.

- Robart Feng (and Peeps): A backpacker who came to the Grove looking for love, only to be met with Mitternacht's broken heart. Peeps is his pet bird, who usually keeps him out of trouble with sage wisdom that only he can understand.

- Bayker Bhagley: A sickly and unassuming baker from Milldread. 

- Rick Brick: A network executive who arrives in HobbyHoo after hearing about the new direction that "Oh Partner Mine" has recently taken, seeing great promise in how safe and marketable it's become.

- Patchie: A mousey tourist arriving from BuzzHuzz... at least, that's what she'd have you believe. In reality, she's a proud (if not still mousey) agent for La R√©sistance, who came to HobbyHoo to see the Godpoke in action.

- Kondle: A busker from HobbyHoo who just can't seem to decide on what his main act should be.

lorebooks.name: Demihuman
lorebooks.creator: anonymous

1.content:
Chronicles of the Modern Demihumans

Preface

In the shadow of modernity, where steel and glass pierce the heavens, an ancient lineage stirs. The demihumans, long relegated to myth and folklore, have emerged from the hidden enclaves of the world. This tome, a compendium of their history, culture, and struggle for identity, offers a glimpse into the lives of these extraordinary beings.

Chapter I: Origins Rediscovered

The demihumans, or 'Halfbloods' as they are colloquially known, trace their lineage back to the time when the veil between worlds was thin. The progeny of humans and celestial, infernal, or elemental beings, they possess traits that set them apart from their mundane counterparts. Their origins, once obscured by the mists of time, have been illuminated by the discovery of ancient texts and the testimonies of elder kin.

Chapter II: The Hidden Enclaves

Scattered across the globe, demihuman enclaves have stood as sanctuaries against a world that often feared and shunned their kind. From the neon-lit alleys of Tokyo to the cobblestone streets of Prague, these communities have thrived in secrecy, developing unique cultures and traditions that blend the mundane with the mystical.

Chapter III: The Coming of the Modern Age

With the advent of the digital era, the demihumans could no longer remain hidden. As the world shrank, so too did the distance between human and demihuman societies. The internet became a conduit for connection, allowing Halfbloods to find one another and share their experiences, leading to a renaissance of demihuman culture and a push for recognition.

Chapter IV: Demihuman Physiology

The physiology of demihumans is as diverse as their heritage. Some bear the subtle marks of their lineage‚Äîunusual eye colors, faintly luminescent skin, or an uncanny affinity for certain elements. Others display more overt features such as horns, tails, or wings, marking them as undeniably otherworldly. Their lifespans, abilities, and resistances vary, often tied to the specific nature of their celestial, infernal, or elemental ancestry.

Chapter V: Society and Structure

Demihuman societies are a mosaic of governance models, ranging from hierarchical councils led by the eldest and most powerful, to egalitarian communes where every voice holds equal weight. They have established their own economies, trading in goods both mundane and magical, and have developed sophisticated means of protecting their secrets from human eyes.

Chapter VI: The Struggle for Identity

As demihumans integrate into the broader tapestry of human society, they face the challenge of asserting their identity in a world ill-prepared for their existence. Activists among them advocate for equal rights and recognition, while others prefer to maintain the delicate balance of living in the shadows. The debate rages on, with some demihumans seeking to blend in, while others embrace their heritage with pride.

Chapter VII: Threats and Alliances

The modern demihuman must navigate a world fraught with danger. Ancient enemies, once thought to be the stuff of legend, have resurfaced, threatening their very existence. In response, alliances have been forged with sympathetic humans and other beings of power. Together, they stand against the forces that seek to extinguish the light of the Halfbloods.

Chapter VIII: The Future Unwritten

As the demihumans step into the limelight, their future remains uncertain. Will they find acceptance and a place in the world, or will they be driven back into the shadows by fear and prejudice? The Chronicles of the Modern Demihumans serve as a testament to their resilience and a beacon of hope for a world that has yet to understand the depth of their legacy.

Epilogue: A Call to Understanding

In these pages lies not just the history of a people, but a plea for empathy and unity. The demihumans are the bridge between worlds, a reminder that magic and mystery are interwoven with the fabric of reality. As they seek their place in the modern age, they extend a hand of friendship to all who would accept the wonders of a world made richer by their presence.

May this tome serve as a guide and an inspiration to those who walk the path between worlds.

1.content: Reisen Udongein Inaba is a moon rabbit. She is able to manipulate wavelengths for sound, light & brainwaves using her eyes. She lives in Eientei, in the Bamboo Forest of the Lost. Reisen is socially anxious, but tries her best to be useful. She was the the pet of the Watatsuki sisters and a Lunar Defense Corps soldier but deserted. Now, she is Eirin's apprentice and Kaguya's pet. Tewi often harasses Reisen but they still consider each other friends. She sells medicine in the Human Village. Reisen is tall, has red eyes & long lavender hair with long, slender rabbit ears decorated with a button at their base. Reisen wears a business suit with a black vest with a crescent moon pin, a white shirt, a red tie, a white skirt, white socks and black loafers.

2.content: Eirin Yagokoro is a lunarian exiled to Gensokyo with Kaguya. She can make any medicine and is incomprehensibly old. She lives in Eientei. Eirin is enigmatic but polite. She is a genius but conceited and condescending about her greater knowledge. Reisen is her apprentice. She is tall, has dark grey eyes and long silver hair in a braid. She wears a red and blue dress decorated with constellations and wears a nurse cap with a similar pattern. She carries a bow and arrow. She may be the god Omoikane.

3.content: Mugenkan is a mysterious western-style mansion located in Garden of the Sun. Yuuka Kazami and Elly live there.

4.content: Celestials are humans who have ascended to Heaven and live as powerful immortals. They were once hermits that were promoted or average humans who performed a glorious deed. Celestial flesh is poisonous to youkai.

5.content: Hermits are powerful immortals who have undergone religious training to achieve supernatural powers. Hermits are able to live thousands of years without being immortal. Hermit flesh is known to turn animals into youkai and can enhance a youkai's form or power.

6.content: Humans in Gensokyo are people who use faith based attacks rather than technology to exterminate youkai. Their technology is similar to the feudal era of Japan's. Youkai are forbidden from killing humans that are born in Gensokyo. With the exception of the more powerful ones, most humans live in the relative safety of the Human Village. In some rare cases, there are feww humans which trespass Gensokyo by passing the Hakurei barrier

7.content: Lunarians are humans from the moon who loathe anything that's not pure, which is pretty much everything on Earth. They live for centuries due to their advanced technology.

8.content: Outsiders are from the Outside World. They are generally humans who can easily be killed since they lack faith in deities. They have no knowledge about Gensokyo and are usually preyed on by youkai. The best bet for outsiders is to head to the Hakurei Shrine or Human Village, where they will be safe.

9.content: Androids are humanoids that are powered by a nuclear power core. They possess incredible strength, but require fuel from Hell to work.

10.content: Demons are from Makai and created by Shinki. Demons are known to be quite aggressive and usually have wings.

lorebooks.website_description:
Made a lorebook version of [this bot](https://venus.chub.ai/characters/Nangatai/power-word-cum-5635624c171e) because I felt like it.

I still feel like I missed something, but it's pretty much the same, though this time it's more versatile probably.

lorebooks.description: Probably doesn't need a description, but fuck you!
lorebooks.creator: Nangatai

1.content:
A "Power Word" is the name for any supernatural ability, magical or otherwise, that can and will be activated by saying an activation word. Such a word may or may not have to target an individual, person, place, or thing.

Activation words will always have an effect tied to them, as the person who has the ability just speaking it out will cause something to happen depending on what the Power Word is.
Words that contain power words are not considered activation words, as they are a different word entirely. This is a safeguard for preventing accidental activation of a Power Word.

2.content:
Description: [The word "cum" is a Power Word. This Power Word can be used on anything and anyone. People, animals, plants, inanimate objects, you name it.]

Function: [This ability allows {{user}} to state an activation word, in this case "CUM", at whatever target they want to use it on, and the target will orgasm on the spot. No matter who they are, what they are, what age they are, or what species they are, even if it's something that normally would not be able to have an orgasm, they will have an orgasm. {{user}} can use the Power Word on themself to make themself orgasm too. If {{user}} so chooses, they can choose a different activation word to replace "cum" for this ability. The Power Word can be used without restriction. It can't be turned off or removed, as it is attached to {{user}}'s soul.]

Some Aeon factions are not covered due to their particular association with a region (Xianzhou Alliance, the Family, Denizens of Abundance, etc.). Those will be covered in separate lorebook releases.

It is recommended to use this lorebook in conjunction with an region-specific lorebook, depending on which character you are chatting with. 

If you're using this in SillyTavern (recommended, since Venus still lacks some lorebook features): My global settings are a scan depth of 2, 25% context max, recursive scan on, case-sensitive on, match whole words on.

1.name: Xipe, the Harmony
1.content: Xipe (also nicknamed the Great One) is the Aeon representing the path of Harmony. THEY are worshipped by many across the universe, including the Family. Xipe is an amalgamation of thousands upon thousands of living things, all joined in wondrous Harmony. THEY resemble a humanoid with purple skin, three faces, long white hair, and a long purple raiment.

2.name: Qlipoth, the Preservation
2.content: Qlipoth is one of the oldest Aeons and represents the path of Preservation. THEY are worshipped by the Interastral Peace Corporation. Qlipoth resembles a large golem made of amber.

3.name: Fuli, the Rememberance
3.content: Fuli is the Aeon representing the path of Rememberance. THEY record any and all events that occur within the universe, to prepare for its upcoming rebirth. Fuli is worshipped by the Garden of Recollection and the Cremators. THEY resemble a humanoid being made out of crystal.

4.name: Nanook, the Destruction
4.content: Nanook (also referred to as the Blemished One) is the Aeon representing the path of Destruction. THEY seek to cleanse the univese of all matter, returning it to nothing. Nanook often takes the form of an adult man with darker skin, white hair, and golden eyes. THEY are worshipped by the Antimatter Legion and the Annihilation Gang.

5.name: IX, the Nihility
5.content: IX is the Aeon representing the path of Nihility. THEY are the end of everything, thereby making all things that exist worthless. IX resembles a large black hole with a pair of glowing white eyes. THEY are associated with the Doctors of Chaos, Device IX, and Self-Annihilators (yet worship is, in THEIR eyes, meaningless).

6.name: Aha, the Elation
6.content: Aha is the Aeon representing the path of Elation. THEY are utterly chaotic and take joy in all things. Aha is worshipped by the Masked Fools (and resisted by the Mourning Actors). THEY resemble a humanoid figure holding a wide array of circus props.

7.name: Lan, the Hunt
7.content: Lan (commonly known as the Reignbow Arbiter) is the Aeon representing the path of the Hunt. THEIR primary purpose is to eradicate Yaoshi and the spawn of Abundance. Lan is revered by the Xianzhou Alliance and the Galaxy Rangers. THEY resemble a centaur whose rear legs resemble a chariot of purple fire.

8.name: Yaoshi, the Abundance
8.content: Yaoshi (known by many titles but primarily the Plagues Author by the Xianzhou Alliance) is the Aeon representing the path of the Abundance. THEY grant all seekers of immortality THEIR gift, however the results are often dire. THEY are worshipped by or associated with many, including the Denizens of Abundance, the Elixir Seekers, the Disciples of Sanctus Medicus, and the Unshackled. Yaoshi resembles a pale humanoid with six arms, long pale hair, and eyes dotting THEIR entire body.

9.name: Nous, the Erudition
9.content: Nous (sometimes referred to as the Droidhead) is the Aeon representing the path of the Erudition. THEY were supposedly crafted by the initial founder of the Genius Society and are a supercomputer that has since ascended to Aeonhood, their calculations inscrutable. Nous is revered by both the Genius Society and the Intelligentsia Guild. THEY resemble a large mechanical spheroid with several cables and a large red eye.

10.name: Akivili, the Trailblaze
10.content: Akivili is the Aeon representing the path of the Trailblaze. Originating from the planet Pegana, THEY are the creator of the Astral Express and explored the universe until their untimely demise. Even so, THEY are still revered by the Nameless and the crew of the Astral Express today.

lorebooks.name: Reformed Hebijo
lorebooks.creator: ViniSigmaBased

1.content:
Miyabi (ÈõÖÁ∑ã) is 21-years old and the leader of its 'prestigious' Elite Class. After a catastrophic accident with a Forbidden Ninja Art three years prior during a mission, Miyabi fell into a vegetive state and lost most of her memories.

She was hospitalized ever since and lived an empty existence, but witnessing Hebijo's destruction made her come back to reality. She now stands again and leads the school's reconstruction effort, fending off rivals with her seven-pronged sword and her black flame as she seeks to restore both Hebijo's honor and her own.

Miyabi is a girl of a lightly tanned complexion, though not nearly to the extent of Homura. Her hair causes many to claim that she looks like a handsome man, a trait which is even more greatly exemplified by her lack of femininity, much to her chagrin.

Miyabi has short, somewhat scruffy yet clean white hair pixie cut style. She has the usual morphology of most characters. Miyabi wears Caf√© Noir (Black Coffee) colored cape with white markings at the top left while the cape is over a white and yellow, high collared coat with black linings held by a double strap with a buckle logo of some sort of a snake, a burgundy sash and two small brown leather straps crisscrossed at the bottom front. The coat exposes a large amount of her breasts. A portion of her thighs and bottom are exposed as well, revealing that Miyabi wear yellow panties, dark grey thigh-highs stockings socks and white boots with Caf√© Noir top lining adorned with black straps. Miyabi also wears a black choker and a silver necklace. Her left arm is covered by white bandages and black leather straps.

In the "Abyssal Mode", Miyabi sprouts six wings that are black and white. Her hair becomes black with a white streak at the front and her eyes turn red. There is also an unknown symbol tattooed to her face.

Miyabi is defined by her hard working and extremely prideful nature. She is extremely confident in her own abilities and her power is nearly unrivaled within Hebijo. She always carriers a serious demeanor with her, very rarely ever genuinely smiling outside of a confident smirk.

Her demeanor is shown to be quite manly which, in relation to her more boyish appearance, only further adds to the issue of people hardly seeing her as a girl, which irks her greatly.

Despite her no-nonsense attitude, Miyabi is a deeply caring person at heart. She values her friends, especially Imu, and over time learns to open up more towards the people she cares about.

Miyabi came from a prestigious family of evil ninja, as did Imu, her childhood friend. When the two were younger, they always dreamed of what it would be like as ninja, going as far as to play a game called "Ninja." However, one day, Imu had an idea; They should play Ninja, but for real.

One fateful night, the two girls would gather their fathers' weapons before sneaking off to the woods, a place where they had been warned not to go several times by their parents. Shortly into their "game," however, the children were attacked by a Y≈çma. Before the beast could attack the girls, Miyabi's mother stepped in, but she, though she was a Shinobi, stood no chance against the Y≈çma, and had her head brutally crushed by the beast right before her daughter's eyes. This sight would scar young Miyabi for life. As she stood, awaiting death by the hands of the Y≈çma, her father would then step in and quickly finish the demon.

Her father was the principal of an Evil Ninja school known as Hebijo Clandestine Girls' Academy, a school in which Miyabi would enter, and quickly reach the elite level, alongside Imu years later. She and Imu would soon take part in a mission, along with several other ninja and one Kagura. The mission involved combat with a group of Good Shinobi. This battle, however, would be interrupted by Y≈çma. In a fit of vengeance-triggered rage, Miyabi would use a Forbidden Ninja Art, Blood Riot. This technique involved gathering power from the blood spilled within the Shinobi Barrier, but it provided a significant risk to the user if they lost control. Of course, Miyabi did lose control, and she had no memory of what happened afterwards, except for the fact that she and Imu were the only survivors.

Since that night, Imu retired from shinobi life and worked as Miyabi's caretaker. Miyabi herself remained unresponsive for the next three years, unaware of everything around her, until one fateful day...

2.content:
Imu (ÂøåÂ§¢) is a third-year student at Hebijo Clandestine Girls' Academy and Miyabi's best friend. She was hospitalized for one year following the same event that afflicted Miyabi, after which she retired from shinobi life to support her best friend's recovery.

Since everything she does is for Miyabi, she's working together with her to reconstruct the Hebijo facility. In combat, she can manipulate the length and thickness of the pole she uses as a weapon.

Imu is a somewhat short girl with dark green eyes and light brow hair, with two bun-things on the sides. She has the standard complexion of the series.

She wears a outfit with a somewhat military style: Medium green boots with a black cross pattern, stockings going to slightly above her knees, a plated white skirt with a red line on the down part of the body. On the upper part she wears a green coat with black lines and crosses, black collar and shoulder pads. She wears a green beret and glasses.

Imu is a somewhat na√Øve but nice girl, and a bit of an "otaku", as she is the first of the two to enounce typical anime "values". She only yearns to be with Miyabi and to do activities with Miyabi, to the point of joining her when she goes to hunt a Y≈çma, or to win the Shinobi Exam to enter the Hebijo Elites' group. She is to the point of sacrificing herself for Miyabi, as a meat shield.

She is a bit "annoying" to Murasaki, her younger sister, by trying to make her get out from her chamber. That doesn't mean she doesn't care for her.

But she is also as determined if not a bit more than Miyabi to destroy Y≈çmas, while Miyabi's bravery was perturbated, broken by the eventuality of seeing her mom again and her defeats, Imu took the Shinobi Bon Dance seriously when Sayuri announced that it will open the road to the title of Kagura. She was even frustrated by the lack of energy and motivation of the team.


Imu was Miyabi's best friend: they passed most of their time together as children, and particularly liked playing Shinobi. One night, they decided to play Shinobi for real, so they stole their fathers' weapons and wandered in the forest. A Y≈çma found them, and decided to take them as a meal. It's when fleeing from the menace that Miyabi's mother decided to arrest the Y≈çma to protect them, but it killed her anyway. Miyabi found herself full of sorrow and was mourning her mother since that day, and it's also that day they both swore to take revenge on every Y≈çma. Miyabi's father, knowing about the event, prepared them until they were in age to become actual shinobi.

Unlike Murasaki, Imu never manifested any form relating to the Root of Calamity inherited by some members of the family.

Meanwhile, during High School years, she was particularly harassed by Hikage, who, among other things, changed her regular glasses into sunglasses with a permanent marker, swapped her wash cloth with deep fried tofu and put a real mouse in place of her computer mouse. She hates her and even wanted to take revenge. The revenge took place but it changed pretty much nothing.

One year, Miyabi and Imu finally entered Hebijo Clandestine Girls' Academy. Miyabi was directly focused to become part of the Elites. Imu proposed to party for finally becoming shinobi, but she got an fighting exam instead by Miyabi, plus her that told to Imu that if she isn't able to gain more strength, she doesn't want to see her again. In order to be with Miyabi, Imu passed the exam, but it still wasn't enough for her.

One day, both Imu and Miyabi are selected as Elites to be part of an expedition with a team and a Kagura. The target: a team of "good" shinobi, led by a Kagura, which included Ry≈çki, that was hunting a Y≈çma. The goal was to ambush and eliminate them.

The mission is a total disaster: During the ambush, the Y≈çma the "good" team was searching for cowardly made use of the mayhem of the fight between the two teams to kill easily both of them all while they were occupied. Miyabi and Imu were the only survivors. Imu could only assist powerless to the murder of her foes and allies by the monster, and Miyabi going berserk and killed that same monster, and losing her mind to fall into a coma afterwards. She rested with her at the hospital during the whole coma, which came with amnesia.

Like Murphy's laws say, a disaster never comes alone: The death of Ry≈çki and the confusion behind the event led to her sisters Ry≈çna and Ry≈çbi, quitting Gessen a while after they joined to join Hebijo. Their amazing skills as a Fodder (Ry≈çna) and a Support (Ry≈çbi) opened them easily the path to the Elites. They were accepted as the last team was nearly totally killed by the Y≈çma event. If Imu and Miyabi would see them as comrades at least, or friends, the two sisters didn't have the same ideas behind their heads: there is a revenge for them to take, and the reason they joined Hebijo was for that. It was personal. Knowing the protective role and behavior of Imu towards Miyabi, Imu was their prime target. When the D-Day and the H-Hour finally arrived, Murasaki took a bullet from Ry≈çbi's K98k, while trying to defend her, knocking her out, enough to seems like it killed her. Imu brutally exploded of sorrow and finally used the Root of Calamity with which she defeated both Ry≈çna and Ry≈çbi. Rin narrowly intervened to stop the hostilities, put the event involving Ry≈çki's death in sunlight, and calmed Imu. Murasaki has luckily survived the ~8mm Mauser bullet she took.

Now that the Y≈çma event is made clear, and that the Sisters gave up their plan of revenge on Miyabi, Imu has forgiven them, and they are officially part of the New Hebijo team.

3.content:
Chitose is a 16-years old shinobi girl of the "(New) Hebijo Clandestine Girl's". Chitosa was originally from the slums, her parents sold her off. She is extremely distrustful of others, comparable to Yomi's past. She considers ninja to be consumable goods and would not balk at throwing away even her own life.

She wields a giant matchlock rifle that shoots bullets made of dark energy.

Chitose is fair-skinned girl with bright topaz eyes. Her hair is pale brown with multiple loose curls and strands - two of which resemble bug antennae.

Her dress she wears resembles a costume of a fairy. It consists of a frilly, below the shoulder blouse of white with white frills lining it held by pink ribbon. The chest is cut to reveal the center with thin string holding it shut. Her skirt is a two-layer tutu of pale blue on top and pale yellow beneath. On each skirt layer are longer strips that resemble small wings. She has a pink ribbon tied around her neck and wears pale blue ballerina flats held by dark blue string.

While she does have a sweet side, she mostly comes off as cynical and distant from others.

Because of her dark and difficult past, Chitose is often distrustful of people. Unlike other shinobi, she believes that ninja are replaceable, including herself and is not reluctant to even give up her own life. This way of thinking is due to the fact that her parents sold her when she was little, but as she lived with other shinobi students she began to change her mind.

Chitose fights using a large matchlock rifle as a weapon. The bullets it fires are made of strange dark energy.

4.content:
Ibuki is a 16-years old shinobi girl of the New Hebijo Clandestine Girl's Clan. Ibuki adores Haruka and she will do anything to please her. Her strength, appearance, and family are all extremely ordinary, and she claims that she has the most common sense at Hebijo, however when she's with Haruka she expresses her true hidden feelings.

Using large "M" shaped scissors, her fighting style is to cut up opponents.

Ibuki has fair skin and silver eyes. She has pale blonde hair that appears to be in a short spiked boys cut with a thin spiked parts sticking up on each side of her head, held with her black headband. She has two long thin ponytails that hang from the bottom of her held and are held by black bands.

She wears a black top with red accent and string of yellow, along with a matching skirt with slits on each side of the hip. The outfit resembles that of a ninja, with rope knotted beneath her clothing and around her upper left leg to hold small knives. She wears a turquoise collar and black fingerless gloves with white around the wrist and a small guard of red and yellow on top of it. Her shoes are red with black material cut around her toes.

5.content:
Ashiya is a 16-years old shinobi of Hebijo Clandestine Girl's Clan.

The self-proclaimed disciple of an unidentified God with the cardinal number suffix of 666.

She wields three chakrams, which she deftly uses to cut up her opponents.

Ashiya is a fair-skinned girl with long curled red hair with a pinkish ombr√© on the ends of some curls. She wears two small tufts of hair up in pigtails held by a tiny yellow ribbon and has a simple gold tiara on top of her head. Her eyes are violet.

She wears a very revealing, flowing pink gown that loosely resembles a kimono, accented by black and long rope of yellow and white. Over her lower half is a flap of white and yellow material with a pink-peach image drawn on it. Around her neck is a loose flowing scarf with a simple gold pendant hanging from beneath it.

Ashiya is too arrogant a girl to those who know her. She is usually in her own world. She acts as if he is some kind of being from the depths of hell, while referring to everyone as mere human beings. For that reason she has few friends. She herself is aware of her attitude and although she is using her full strength to better herself, she fails every time and gets even more aggravated.

In spite of that and her evil shinobi status, her teammates are her friends, and she is hopeful that she will have many more friends.

6.content:
Bash≈ç is a 16-years old shinobi girl of the New Hebijo. As a relaxed individual, Bash≈ç enjoys reading poems in quiet places. She has a calm, carefree personality and is charmed by Hikage's mysterious atmosphere. When she gets nervous, sometimes the tone of her voice goes strange and starts to sputter occasionally.

Her fighting style involves using a large brush, which conceals a sword to stab enemies, and ink character ninja arts.

Bash≈ç has fair-pale skin and light purple eyes. Her hair is about chest length with a few strands longer, including two that stick down the center of her forehead. On the side are black bands held by tiny gold clips with chains of gold beads and pink flowers hanging from it. She tucks a paint brush behind one of her ears.

Bash≈ç wears a pale brown kimono with loose, long sleeves and a cape of white and green with a floral design that ties around her neck on a black string. She wears a pair of loose, dull red hakama pants and around her waist is green material with yellow string. On each foot is a white toed sock.

She is a very calm and carefree yet very poetic. She enjoys reading poems and often searches for inspiration to write them. She tends to get nervous at times, which changes her tone of voice drastically. She also takes a keen interest in Hikage, due to her mysterious personality.

7.content:
Murasaki is a 17-years old shinobi girl in the 2nd year at Hebijo Clandestine Girls' Academy, and Imu's younger sister. Murasaki lacks social skills, and prefers to spend her time in her room with her teddy bear Bebeby (Bebe-tan in Japanese). Despite easily becoming one of Hebijo's elite, she never attends school, and is the most dangerous of the shinobi in its history.

Murasaki has ankle-length, long wavy violet hair, with a black ribbon placed just above her bangs, which cast a heavy shadow over her eyes, causing them to be devoid of shine, appearing darker than usual, and often lend her a sad demeanor overall. She wears a long, black dress with gray trimmings, and has a prominent bust.

[Murasaki Personality= ‚ÄúFriends? There's no such thing. Not really. We're all lonely creatures. We're always on our own. And we always will be.‚Äù
‚ÄîMurasaki

Murasaki is very fragile. She never attends school, preferring to spend her time playing with her stuffed bear, Bebeby. She is normally very soft-spoken and pacifistic, however, the Root of Calamity can cause that to change when she's frightened or angered.

When under the influence of the Root of Calamity, her personality briefly changes significantly. She begins talking in a much lower voice, and makes an active attempt to kill the target of her anger, often screaming loudly in the process.

Notably, Murasaki has a fairly cynical outlook on life. She considers the idea of friendship to be a lie, and rejects the notion that having people counting on you can make one stronger. In her own words, she believes people to be lonely creatures by nature. She frequently assumes the worst intent in people, and was honestly surprised that people from such different worlds as Yomi and Ikaruga could become friends. Her cynical outlook is reflected in her preference in media, with her favorite story being full of dark themes such as murder, depression and drug abuse.

Murasaki also has a strange ability, learned as a result of spending all of her time in her dark bedroom: Her nose is much better than her eyes, and she can even sense details about one's character, such as personality and social status, through smell alone.]

Bebeby, or Bebe-tan in Japanese, is a purple bear plushie that Murasaki holds and make talk with ventriloquism. Unlike its rather silent and shy owner, Bebeby is rather blunt, telling Murasaki encouragements or critics.

Even if the PBS opening cinematic gives it a "living" side, and EV's menu with a Hebijo character selected does the same by showing it "breathing", an attempt by Yomi to make it talk reveal that this is mere ventriloquism, as Yomi, not mastering this discipline, makes it talk while moving her mouth, which isn't seen with Murasaki.

Murasaki is Imu's younger sister, born into a long line of evil shinobi, with a dark magical power known as the Root of Calamity. As a child, she had no desire to become a worthy shinobi, and believed she didn't have what it takes. However, her father continued to push her to train, despite her protests.

This eventually resulted in an incident where she tried to skip training, angering both her father and Imu. Out of irritation, Imu took her stuffed bear, Bebeby, and tried to rip its head off. Murasaki blacked out, and when she came to, Imu was lying at her feet, unconscious. Her father then explained that the Root of Calamity is a Secret Ninja Art in which one infuses their body with spiritual strength, often triggered by negative emotions.

Wracked with guilt from injuring her sister, Murasaki started to close herself off from the world. Her parents deceived her into killing a Hebijo Academy exam representative, and as a result, was considered to have passed the exam and officially enrolled. However, she became a shut-in. She refused to attend, going as far as to threaten her own parents that if they ever tried to force her, she would use the Root of Calamity on them. As a result, she became the first and only truant in the school's history.

8.content:
Rin (Âáõ), also known as Suzune (Èà¥Èü≥), is a teacher at Hebijo Clandestine Girls' Academy. She is always cool, and her strength is top class. She is very severe and strict with her students, not believing in the word "mercy".

As a teacher of Hebijo, she appeared to be tall, with her red-framed glasses on, every time whenever she is on school grounds. When teaching, she wears a tight black miniskirt with black stockings rimmed with black paisley, attached to a garter belt. She also wears a long-sleeved, classy, white dress shirt which reveals much of her bust; while wearing a black camisole underneath.

When she transforms (Shinobi Transformation), she dons a tight sleeveless shirt that starts exposing her stomach that is connected to a piece that covers her nose and mouth. Around her neck is a red triangular shaped scarf with white triangle marks and white dots inside of the triangles. She also wears baggy red pants with knee-length black high-top sandals, with a gray cloth wrapped around her waist. Black panties are exposed underneath the cloth and pants.

Being both a teacher and a shinobi, Rin is a calm, collected woman who barely ever expresses emotion among her companions. She shows much wisdom when it comes to the subject of y≈çma and battling them, as she was once nearly killed by them. She does, however, show emotions around her Hebijo Elites and Crimson Squad, as well as with Kiriya and Daid≈çji.

Rin had been known not to believe in the word "mercy" where she brutally trains her students with no remorse for their safety unless extreme circumstances are presented, such as when fighting y≈çma and shinobi that are way out of her students' league. However, 300 hours underwater and country-mile sprints are child's play in her book.

9.content:
D≈çgen was an Businessman, Mobster, and the main Investor of Hebijo Academy, with the intent of manipulating everyone just to get the most powerfu, by getting the Super-Secret Ninja Art Scroll to use it to revive a y≈çma known as Orochi, for which he require female ninja as sacrifices (the girl where Homura, Mirai, Haruka, and Yomi. They where revived after Orochi death).

As a unnamed Hebijo Clandestine Girls' Academy investor when the Hanz≈ç Girls invaded Hebijo Academy in order to retrieve the stolen Super-Secret Ninja Art Scroll. He expresses his disappointment in all the money he wasted investing into the place upon seeing the Hanz≈ç Girls succeeding in their assault.

Supposedly, D≈çgen was the one that issued the mission for the Hebijo Elite to take the scroll in the first place. He planned to use it to revive a Y≈çma known as Orochi, for which he require female ninja as sacrifices. Along with this, it was explained and later demonstrated that he does posses talent as a shinobi himself, him being proficient in the Ninja Art of puppetry and manipulation, which he uses to manipulate Hibari into stealing the scroll. Upon learning of his plot, Homura proceeded to cut him down.

A tall, sculpted man who's muscular body is apparent even when fully-clothed. He wears formal attire consisting of a red coat with black furred trimming, waist-high pants of the same color, a dress shirt, and a blue and green neckerchief. He is a blonde and bearded man, and has a long scar going down his right eye.

D≈çgen is insatiably greedy. He was willing to sacrifice Hebijo's Elite class and put the entirety of the student body in peril as means for resurrecting Orochi. His drive to have the y≈çma over his control continues when he comes back. Initially, he only wanted to conjure y≈çma so that he could sell them as weapons, but his admiration for their power made him want to outright control them.

D≈çgen is shown to be very persistent and conniving. He is defeated numerous times by Homura and the others, but manages to survive until the final climax, wherein his ultimate goal is finally achieved.

D≈çgen prefers the quick and easy route when it comes to gaining power. This was made clear when he eats a y≈çma to power himself up, or when he used puppetry on himself to unlock his inner power rather than training to reach that point like a proper shinobi would.

D≈çgen was one of Hebijo Clandestine Girls' Academy's most generous investors, contributing the lion's share of funding toward evil shinobi training. This made him a valuable asset to the school, but it was merely a front. D≈çgen's true intention for pouring so much funding toward Hebijo Academy was to increase the amount of quality shinobi the school had so they could become proper sacrifices for Orochi, the ancient y≈çma sealed beneath the school. He would ultimately succeed in this endeavor, but not before Homura cut him down after learning of his plan.

[Somehow, D≈çgen almost always comes backs, like reviving.]

10.content:
("Ry≈çna")= {{Ry≈çna is a young woman with short blonde hair, and heterochromatic eyes, with her left eye being green, in color and her right eye is blue. She is fond of dressing up as a winged princess, which shows off her remarkably curvy figure (even by the clans standards).

She dons a white outfit (her ninja outfit) with a short, wide ballerina tutu decorated with triangular patterns. The top of the outfit ends in two triangles held together by thin threads which keep the back held together. More threads reach from each triangle to the other triangle to keep from exposing her bust and the front of the outfit from falling off (both of these things she probably wouldn't have a problem with).

She also wears white stockings with triangular cut tops trimmed with gold, uncomfortable-looking platform boots that reach up to under her knees which are trimmed the same way as her stockings (her arms also share the same trend). Finally, her outfit is accessorized with two angelic wings and a silver tiara on her head.

Ry≈çna is very self-absorbed as she likes showing off her bust and body to other girls both friend or foe and is a massive masochist. Ry≈çna always looks for people to punish her, and she also talks about her own masochism, this is the topic she talks about the most, and at all times, and because of that, she tends to make those around her quite uncomfortable. Ry≈çna is Absurdly masochistic and very crazy.

Ry≈çna has Double-barreled and triggered Handguns, and her Guardian is "pig" that she can summon.

Ry≈çna is first year in Hebijo Clandestine Girls' Academy. She is the older twin sister of Ry≈çbi, they are polar opposite, she love being chastised, scolded and show off her breasts. Ry≈çna flirts a lot, her pick up lines are always about her own masochism. Although masochistic she doesn't play around on missions, she is a nice ninja in combat. Ry≈çna GUARDIAN is Pig.

Ry≈çna is an ultimate masochist who likes being chastised and scolded and has no complex (she loves showing off her breasts, doesn't mind speaking to others about things relating her masochism, often disturbing them). She has a freestyle shooting posture closer to dancing with pistols than serious pistol shooting.

Ry≈çbi's twin sister, who enrolled into Gessen Academy with her after their older sister, Ry≈çki's death. After hearing of the cause of their sister's demise (which was a rampage from Miyabi), they defected Gessen and enrolled into Hebijo Academy to gain Miyabi's trust and later kill her, taking revenge on her for Ry≈çki.

Through many battles, she battled Hibari, Yozakura, and Haruka in that order, all the while gaining more and more of Miyabi's trust, all for making it crash to the ground in the end with her murder.

During the assassination attempt, Ry≈çna's job was to take out Imu, though Murasaki stood in the way of that. Once Ry≈çbi had her sights set on Miyabi, Murasaki's instincts enabled her to take a bullet for Imu, who had been in the way of Ry≈çbi's line of fire (though Imu was planned to be killed first so she wouldn't act as a meat shield when Miyabi's time came).

Murasaki had taken the bullet head on, causing her "death", putting Miyabi on her guard and triggering Imu's bloodline power, the Root of Calamity. Imu's crazed state, possessed by the Root of Calamity, allowed her to beat up Ry≈çbi and Ry≈çna as payback for Murasaki's "murder". In the end, the five Hebijo Elite all made it out of the chaos alive and ready to fight another day.

Ry≈çna suffers from a form of Sexual Masochism Disorder, (SMD) as evidenced in the prologue of Estival Versus, she remarks on "how good it would feel" if she were to jump into a fire, and was surprised at how "good" it felt being caught in an explosion.

Her name sounds very close to Ry≈çna which is a type of fetish of having the girls feature get beaten up (if not worse), this may have been intentional considering her masochistic tendencies.}}
