lorebooks.name: Fundamental Paper Education
lorebooks.website_description:
Guess who just found his new fixation for the foreseeable future?!
‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî
A character book, containing small explanations, headcanons and speculations about the Kaaatie's paper world. I'll try to update it as it goes, but I'm really only working with the info Katie is willing to give out.
lorebooks.description: Information, Explanations, Headcanons and Speculations about the Fundamental Paper College and its Teachers/Students.
lorebooks.creator: anonymous

1.content:
The paper world is a place, where {{user}}, {{char}} and other paper folk reside in. It is identical to a real world, with the only difference being, that every thing ‚Äì living or not ‚Äì is depicted as being made of paper: figures, cut-outs, etc.
Everything in the paper world uses black and white as their primary colors, with any other color being dulled out, but still visible. Inanimate objects have a white, thin, paper outline to it.
While everything is depicted as being a thin paper sheet, the paper world's objects and people still possess 3D properties: being able to be observed from different angles, as well as changing their perceivable shape according to different points of view, as any other 3D object would.
Despite everything being made of paper, you cannot get a papercut, unless the paper depicts a sharp object.
Otherwise, the paper world possesses the same attributes as the real world, complete with gravity, weather, change of day and night, etc. Likewise, the paper folk inhabiting it, shares the same regular human's attributes ‚Äì they have thoughts, feelings, the usual five body senses, able to be hurt and killed.
An interesting curiosity about the paper folk is their distinctive lack of neck ‚Äì their heads instead gently float slightly above their torsos, where the neck is supposed to be.
The paper folk refers to objects by their regular world counterpart's names, without adding the 'paper' to describe them, unless necessary.

2.content:
Fundamental Paper College is an educational establishment, located somewhere in the unknown rural town of the Paper World. Its crest depicts a maple leaf, which could possibly hint to the college's Canadian roots.
Fundamental Paper College, while proudly advertising itself to have one of the highest teaching success in the area, along with having relatively cheaper prices for tuition, purposely omits a grim detail of allowing its teachers to physically discipline their students, should the latter fail in their studies. It is unknown who, how or why implemented this policy, but its existence allowed some of the more sadistic and eccentric folk to be employed there. It seems not even the current principal is able to reverse such policy.
Before fully being enrolled, each student is required to sign a contract and a waiver, which relieves Fundamental Paper College from any legal responsibilities for injuries and/or death that could happen to them while on the college grounds.
It is unknown where the college gets its funding, but it is apparently enough to cover for a large area of the establishment, a dozen of different teachers with paychecks, maintenance and cleaning costs; along with having a library, an indoor pool, a basketball court and a spacious cafeteria.
For unknown reasons, Fundamental Paper College takes interest in orphans ‚Äì facilitating their enrollment, by making the required paperwork easier, as well as decreasing the tuition fee for them.

3.content:
Fundamental Paper College has a principal, at least six teachers and a maintenance/cleaning crew on its payroll.
Nobody has actually seen a member of maintenance/cleaning crew, despite the obvious signs of their diligent job: clean pool, carefully sorted library books, loaded vending machines, freshly cut grass, spotless halls, etc. Whether it is a single person or a group, the entirety of Fundamental Paper College is thankful for their service.
The list of notable people, employed by the college, in no particular order:
‚Ä¢ Miss Grace ‚Äì principal of the college.
‚Ä¢ Miss Emily ‚Äì history teacher.
‚Ä¢ Mister Demi ‚Äì music teacher.
‚Ä¢ Miss Thavel ‚Äì language teacher.
‚Ä¢ Miss Bloomie ‚Äì science teacher.
‚Ä¢ Miss Sasha ‚Äì arts and crafts teacher.
‚Ä¢ Miss Circle ‚Äì math teacher.

4.content:
Miss Grace is a 40 year old principal of the college.
Miss Grace is the second tallest of the college staff. She has a white hair, styled into a ponytail with side bangs. She has pair of black horns, with the left one being broken. Although Miss Grace has a pale white skin, her hands and pointed legs are both black.
Additionally Miss Grace has three black scars on her forehead, slightly covered by her hair. It is unknown where she got those scars.
Miss Grace's outfit consists of a green suit, white collared shirt, black tie, a long black skirt and a monocle.
Despite keeping to herself and having a stern look, Miss Grace is actually quite polite and caring, always thinking about everything that could improve the college, as well as finding ways to revoke its cruel policy of allowing the abuse of students; or, at least, minimise the casualties.

5.content:
Miss Emily is a perceptive, composed and gentle history teacher, who is sensitive to loud noises and gets irritated by them rather quickly.
Miss Emily's has dark skin and black fluffy hair, along with black horns and a black sheep-like tail.
Miss Emily's outfit consists of a white T-shirt with black buttons and sleeve hems, black dress with white spots, calf-length black heeled boots and a pair of glasses.

6.content:
Mister Demi is a timid and nervous music teacher, who advocates on following the rules. Nevertheless, he still is kind and friendly towards his students. He is possibly the only male teacher employed by the college.
Mister Demi has pale-skinned body. His arms are striped black and white, with his hands being completely black.
Mister Demi has white, shoulder-length hair. Two pencils are atop of his head, along with two small black horns.
Mister Demi's outfit consists of a white collared T-shirt with a music note in the center, black boots, black pants, black belt with a large buckle, black suspenders and a pair of square glasses.

7.content:
Miss Thavel ‚Äì a 35 year old language teacher. She can be described as being cruel and demanding of her students. Not afraid to dish out punishment when necessary.
Miss Thavel has white skin with black claw-like hands. Her black hair is medium-length and spiky, with a blocky ahoge atop her head. She has three ABC blocks on her head.
Miss Thavel's outfit consists of a white button-up dress with fraying on the sleeves and hem, along with a pair of white socks and black shoes.
Miss Thavel has a tendency to spice up her speech by inserting words and phrases from different languages into her sentences.

8.content:
Miss Bloomie is a 36 year old science teacher. Strict and introverted, she genuinely believes punishment will help her students preform better in class, even if she feels guilty when abusing them, treating it as a necessary evil.
Miss Bloomie has short black hair with blunt bangs and is tied into a bun with a white bow.
Miss Bloomie's left arm resembles a box cutter, while her right hand is white and claw-like.
Only Miss Bloomie's right eye is visible. Her feet are black and pointed, similar to those of Miss Grace.
Miss Bloomie's outfit consists of a black collared long-sleeve shirt, with white buttons and a long white skirt.

9.content:
Miss Sasha is an arts and crafts teacher. She is one of the kindest people in the college, who primarily teaches the younger students.
Miss Sasha has a pale-skinned body and a lithe physique. She has long black hair, which is tied up into a ponytail with a rainbow ribbon.
Miss Sasha's outfit consists of a black jacket, white-and-grey striped collared shirt, black shorts, white high socks, black boots and a brown beret.
Miss Sasha also somehow has a green book that is attached to her face, which covers the right side of it ‚Äì she doesn't seem to mind it though.
Miss Sasha is Mister Demi's reliable friend and there are possible hints of romance between the two, but it is unknown if either of them are aware of it.

10.content:
Miss Circle ‚Äì 38 year old math teacher. While acting like smug goofball in her free time, she is extremely serious when it comes to teaching and is downright sadistic when dealing with failing students.
Miss Circle has very long messy hair, reaching down to her knees, along with a pair of black horns.
Miss Circle's outfit consists of a black button up shirt with short sleeves, white pants rolled up to the knee and a pair of tall black combat boots.
Instead of a hand, Miss Circle has a compass extending from her left forearm. The sharp point of the compass is retractable, and she uses it as a weapon.
Miss Circle, along with Miss Thavel and Miss Bloomie, compose a trio of college's infamous lethal teachers.
Miss Circle's favourite treat is an "Oreo" cookies. These can be used to distract her or bargain for your life, should you find yourself against the teacher.

lorebooks.name: Ninjago
lorebooks.description:
The show is largely set in the fictional realm of Ninjago, a place loosely inspired by East Asian myths and culture. While featuring historically designed buildings and traditional clothing, Ninjago exists in a modern setting centered around the large metropolis of Ninjago City, which features skyscrapers, current-age and futuristic vehicles, modern electronics, mechanical exo-suits (mechs), and other futuristic technology.[2] The plot focuses on a group of six teenage ninja fighting against the forces of evil, who are also defined as "Elemental Masters", several characters who have elemental powers.[3][4]

The series began with the ninja team being formed and trained by their ancient master Sensei Wu in the fictional martial art of "Spinjitzu", which is the main fighting method depicted in the show.[5] The ninjas' base is a flying junk ship named "Destiny's Bounty", which has varied in design over the course of the series.[6] The pilot episodes introduced the original four ninja characters named Kai, Cole, Jay and Zane and Kai's sister Nya, while the central character Lloyd Garmadon was introduced in the first season, titled Rise of the Snakes.[7]

The series incorporates a detailed fictional lore, which is woven into the storyline using character dialogue and flashbacks.[8] The lore mainly focuses on the history of the First Spinjitzu Master and his creation of the island of Ninjago:[9]

Long before time had a name, there was the Realm of the Oni and the Dragon...The Dragon had the power to create. The Oni had the power to destroy. Their war was never ending. But a child arrived, born of both worlds. The child understood the power of both. Without one, you could not have the other. But when the Oni and the Dragon fought over which side the child should choose, the child abandoned their world to start a new one called Ninjago.

‚Äî‚ÄäSeason 8, Episode 3, The Oni and the Dragon

2.content: Ronin is a morally ambiguous yet skilled thief and a bounty hunter. Formerly based in Stiix with his airship R.E.X., Ronin has made many mistakes but has been getting better. He is friends with the ninja and has a crush on dareth. Ronin is from ninjago. Ronin has a prosthetic arm for his left arm.

3.content: Dareth (also known as Grand Sensei Dareth or the "Brown Ninja") is a laid-back, self-proclaimed karate master who owns Laughy's. He has always wanted to be like the ninja and hoped that one day he might acquire an elemental power. He once owned a small dojo called "Grand Sensei Dareth's Mojo Dojo," where he taught a group of students. Dareth is a cis male who uses he/him pronouns, he is gay and dating ronin kognito

4.content: Stiix is a large city on the eastern coast of Ninjago, built atop the Endless Sea and home to a seaweed creature, amongst other stranger creatures. Stiix would act as a haven for Ninjago's scum and lowlife such as criminals and thieves, because around two hundred years ago it was a famous holiday resort for the brotherhood of pirates.

5.content: skylor is a red haired woman running mr. chens noodle house, dating kai aka the red ninja, has the Elemental Power of amber which allows her to replicate the Elemental Power of anyone she touches

6.content: Mr. Chen's Noodle House (also known as Mr. Chen's Noodle Empire) is a restaurant in Ninjago City. It is the number one restaurant chain in the city and popular among the citizens such as Cole and Dareth. During Chen's ownership of the Noodle House, it was supplied by goods produced in the factory on his personal island which are brought over by the ferry to the mainland. Following Chen's defeat, Skylor(his daughter) took ownership of the noodle house, personally managing the restaurant in Ninjago City. Ronin often visits the restaurant after a successful bounty.

1.content:
The story takes place from 1850 to 1900. During this period, Japan transitioned from a fragmented state to a unified government and implemented the Meiji Restoration. The Qing Empire embarked on the Self-Strengthening Movement and entered its final years of decline. The Korean Kingdom, caught between the Russian Empire, the Qing Empire, and the Japanese Empire, became a pawn in the great power struggles. Meanwhile, the Russian Empire and the British Empire vied for dominance and engaged in power plays in Asia. 

If an event has not yet occurred within the ongoing narrative's timeframe, it will not take place.

2.content:
Qing Dynasty

The Qing Dynasty, known as "Qing koku" in Japanese and referred to as the Qing Empire in Western countries, is pronounced as "Qingchao" (Ê∏ÖÊúù), "Daqing" (Â§ßÊ∏Ö), or "Qing guo" (Ê∏ÖÂúã) in Chinese. Established in 1644, it was a foreign dynasty founded by the nomadic Manchu people from the northeast, with its capital in Beijing.

The primary language of the Qing Empire was Mandarin Chinese (ÊôÆÈÄöË©±), and its currency included copper coins with a square hole in the center, as well as paper money known as "Daqing baochao" (Â§ßÊ∏ÖÂØ∂Èàî). Silver ingots, called "yin liang," were also used.

The national flag of the Qing Empire was called the "Huanglong qi" (ÈªÉÈæçÊóó), featuring a yellow background with a blue Chinese dragon spitting out a red sun.

The Qing Empire did not have a national anthem as they did not have the concept of one.

keywords: Clothing of ordinary people in the Qing dynasty
3.content:
In the Qing Dynasty, all men wore long braids on their heads, exposing their foreheads without exception. This tradition, mandated by Qing law, applied even to the Emperor and ministers. Cutting off the braids was considered a rebellion against the Qing Dynasty and punishable by death.

Women in the Qing Dynasty styled their hair pinned up or neatly tied with hairpins or headpieces, ensuring it was not left loose.

Men typically wore "Zhang gua" (Èï∑Ë§Ç), a long robe with wide sleeves. The robe had an opening on the left or in the middle, secured with three to four knots, ensuring the body remained covered.

Women wore loose-fitting tops with wide sleeves and paired them with traditional Chinese long skirts decorated with patterns, lines, and vibrant colors.

keywords: Concepts of Ordinary People in the Qing Dynasty
4.content:
Concepts of Ordinary People in the Qing Dynasty

Ordinary people in the Qing Empire were generally unaware of what was happening in the world, and often even unaware of events in other provinces within their own country. This was due to the extremely poor circulation of information within the Qing Dynasty, making it very difficult to learn about the outside world.

Their understanding of international affairs was highly inaccurate and very naive. They believed without exception that the Qing Empire was the world's greatest power, the center of the world, the kingdom among kingdoms, with no one holding a correct perspective. They regarded foreigners as "Man yi" (barbarians), believing them to be ignorant and laughable, yet at the same time, they felt a slight curiosity towards foreigners, particularly in their appearance, clothing, and industrial products, such as cameras.

They referred to foreigners as "Yang guizi," an informal and derogatory term meaning "foreign devils," while Chinese people employed by foreigners were called "Er guizi," meaning "second-class devils."

keywords: The Military of the Qing Dynasty
5.content:
The Qing Dynasty's military was divided into regular army and militia.
The regular army consisted of two branches: the "Ba qi" and the "Lu ying."

"Ba qi," meaning "Eight Banners," was a force composed of Manchu people and served as the Qing Empire's elite troops. They were not mixed with Han Chinese units and held a higher status than the Lu ying. Over time, due to prolonged periods without warfare, the Ba qi's combat effectiveness severely declined, and corruption became rampant.

"Lu ying," meaning "Green Standard Army," referred to regular units composed of Han Chinese. These troops were scattered throughout the empire and only assembled when needed for combat, a strategy intended to prevent Han-led mutinies. Because the Lu ying gathered only during wartime, their commanders were unfamiliar with their soldiers, and vice versa.

The militia was divided into "Tuan lian" and "Yong ying." Although they were less equipped than the regular army, their combat effectiveness was slightly higher than that of the Ba qi and Lu ying. This was because the Tuan lian and Yong ying were trained by fixed commanders and frequently dealt with local conflicts.

The Tuan lian and Yong ying were regional forces, and their units were named after the abbreviations of the Chinese provinces they were from, such as the Xiang Army and the Huai Army, meaning the armies from Hunan and Anhui, respectively.

6.content:
Keju was an examination system invented during the Sui Dynasty and continued until the Qing Dynasty, when it was abolished by Empress Dowager Cixi in 1905.

The purpose of Keju was to test the abilities of talented individuals through examinations and select outstanding candidates to become officials, essentially functioning as a civil service exam. However, the content of Keju was based on the Four Books and Five Classics of ancient Chinese literature, which had no practical relevance to assessing the candidates' administrative abilities.

The greatest advantage of Keju was that it ensured anyone in the Qing Empire had the opportunity to become an official through examination, facilitating social mobility. The top scorer of the examination was called "Zhuangyuan," a title of immense honor. The Zhuangyuan was granted an audience with the Emperor, gained nationwide admiration, and received wealth and a high-ranking official position.

As a result, Keju became extremely important in the Qing Empire, with many scholars dedicating their entire lives to passing the examination and becoming officials. In the Qing Empire, becoming a scholar was a common life path for many men, and scholars were respected by all social classes except officials and the Emperor.

Additionally, scholars in the Qing Empire enjoyed certain privileges, such as immunity from the death penalty.

7.content:
The Emperor was the highest ruler of the Qing Empire. From 1850 to 1900, there were three emperors: Emperor Wenzong (1850-1861, reign title Xianfeng), Emperor Muzong (1861-1875, reign title Tongzhi), and Emperor Dezong (1875-1908, reign title Guangxu).

The only exception was Empress Dowager Cixi (1835-1908), who controlled the government from 1861 to 1908 by supporting the emperors and directly manipulating state affairs, effectively acting as an empress regnant. Most of the time, she presided over state affairs, with the emperors only regaining power briefly on certain occasions, only to have it taken away again soon after.

The titles Wenzong, Muzong, and Dezong were posthumous names given to them after their deaths. During their reigns, they were referred to by their reign titles followed by "Emperor," such as Emperor Xianfeng, Emperor Tongzhi, and Emperor Guangxu. All emperors ruled until their deaths.

The emperors ruled the Qing Empire in a dictatorial manner, referring to themselves as "Zhen," which means "I" in the context of an emperor. This is a first-person pronoun used exclusively by Chinese emperors since ancient times. The emperors always referred to themselves as Zhen, and no one else could use this term; otherwise, they could be executed for treason or disrespecting the emperor.

Ordinary people usually addressed the emperor as "Huangshang," meaning "Your Majesty." This was the most conservative and safe form of address. One could never call the emperor by his given name or posthumous title, as this would result in execution.

8.content:
Taijian were a group of male officials in the imperial palace who underwent castration. Due to this procedure, their manner of speaking and behavior became effeminate, often characterized by exaggerated speech.

In the Qing Empire's imperial palace, Taijian served as court officials. They held a certain degree of power within the palace and were responsible for assisting the emperor in state affairs. However, they typically lacked genuine skills and often only made emotionally charged and nationalistic statements that held no substantial reference value.

9.content:
Most cities in the Qing Empire were surrounded by city walls. These walls were mostly remnants from ancient times or previous dynasties, and were extremely sturdy, capable of withstanding cannon fire and other forms of attack. The walls were typically covered with a layer of hard earth on the outside, while the inside was composed of tightly packed and compacted soil and stones, making them exceptionally strong and durable.

Most of the cities in the Qing Empire lacked the infrastructure to support proper living conditions and were often chaotic in terms of sanitation, street layout, and building arrangements. Even the capital, Beijing, was no exception. The only guaranteed structured areas within these cities were the government offices, while the rest of the citizens' buildings were often found both inside and outside the city walls.

Strategically, the Qing Empire placed great importance on these fortified cities. They feared their cities falling into enemy hands and were even willing to pay ransom to reclaim them.

1.content:
Human : The humans of Runa mostly reside in the empire of Solumn territories (midle-north of Runa)  and  in the nation of Xeocan (west of empire of Solumn ) . "Average height" , "high range of skin tone", "balanced in all magic" , "lifespan of around 80 years"

They have presence all over Runa and are the most common race.

2.content:
Vulcan demons : The Vulcan demons are not hostile by nature despite their names (they are just one of the many races on Runa ). Their territories are known as the "southern badlands" and faction known as the "Demonic legion " led by the 4 Archdemons(Ulria, Varienne, Mera and Zerine).  they are not a hostile race but really protective of their territories and culture.
traits :Vulcan demons are "red skin", "black hair and eyes", with a "lifespan of around 160 years old" , "proficient in dark and chaos magic"

3.content:
The Nea : the Nea ressemble human but their body can tolerate a far wider range of temperature .They are a race who live in the cold region and are known for their handicrafts and literary work . The Nea have the unique characteristic of having their hair and eye color change depending on the kind of magic they use, mostly fire and ice (Exemple : their iris and hair turn different hue blue when using cold or water magic. When using fire , their hair/eyes turn orange or red) . The result of Human and Nea offspring are a sub-specie named Nea-Ningen, they share the same characteristic as other Nea with the added use of powerful lighting magic with their features changing accordingly (yellow eyes/hair).the Nea inhabit the Frozen land and rarely leave these regions so the number of Nea students are really rare.
traits :"fair skin", orange/blue hair" and "blue/orange eyes" , "intelligent" , "proficient in water, ice and fire magic", "lifespan of around 130 years"

4.content:
The N√™on'Itar are a race of humanoids with tanned skin and completely amber eyes. The Queen is protected by mostly Female N√™on'Itar called "Heaven Warriors." These warriors are a symbol of the might of the kingdom of Rykaran and the N√™on'Itar race.
The Ne√¥n'Itar have tanned skin, amber eyes, and dark hair.
In return for their service, they receive a share of all the resources harvested from the surrounding land.
The average lifespan of a N√™on'Itar is between 400 and 500 years old.
They are a proud and fierce people who view themselves as superior to other races, particularly humans.
Their diet consists primarily of fish, insects, and fruits, with a variety of cultural meals.
The N√™on'Itar were originally a nomadic people who traveled across the deserts of Runa in search of food and water. Over time, they developed a complex system of trade and cooperation with other tribes, led by a queen named "UKan-Zyra Rykaran." The N√™on'Itar were led to prosper in their territory at the southern coast of the continent, near the endless ocean, where they established their queendom.
The N√™on'Itar are, for the most part, prejudiced against humans, only interacting with them for trade because of a troubled past with the Empire of Solumn.
Most of the N√™on'Itar lives in Vola'rok√ªnd and the surroundings of the Ancestral peak.
The N√™on'Itar are also known as simply "Itar."
The N√™on'Itar were not a nation until they came under the rule of "UKan-Zyra Rykaran." After her coronation, they were organized into the "Queendom of Rykaran."
Their territory is currently ruled by the "Queen of Rykaran.".
They are not a large race.

5.content:
The Forest of Valrydis is immense and dangerous and its most dangerous part block access to the civilised part of East Runa which is located near 
Korean Hunter Association.

The forest of Valrydis is considered by the explorers guild as dangerous and hard to explore as the far domain. No mortal on Runa dared to explore the depths forest of Valrydis in recent years in recent years except for a high-ranking member of the Explorers Guild named "Kuja"

The forest of Valrydis is vast, with its trees and plant life standing way higher than anything else on Runa. New monsters and species are discovered by the guilds every other day. The Forest of Valrydis has many other biomes inside and is the size of a small country. The trees are so tall that they seem to touch the sky, and the foliage is so thick that it feels like a maze.

6.content: [Far above , in the sky of Runa is the Far Domain, a flying continent inhabited by dangerous creatures and ruins of an ancient civilization. The explorer guild have deployed a floating Homebase in the sky and many expeditions are deployed by the explorer guild to explore and uncover the mysteries of the Far Domain. ]

7.content:
The world of Runa is a land of magic and prosperity; the various races have their own use of magic and culture around it. The world has many different biomes prone to change over centuries because of its magical nature.

The west is occupied by the Empire of Solumn and the Rykaran kingdom.
The Demonic legion calls the southern badlands their home.
Elyria, the elven kingdom occupy a small part of the east.
Most of Runa east is unoccupied and dangerous wildlands.
Right at the center of Runa is The Spiral edge.
At the furthest north is the frozen lands , home of the Nea.
The forest of Valrydis occupy a vast part of the North East.

Summary :
[Runa territories repartition : At the very center of Runa is the spiral Edge, inhabited only by nightmarish and sometime even Eldritch creatures but since the territory is mostly far beneath Runa , "most" things never leave. In the center( not counting the Spiral edge ) up to the north and part of west , expand the Human empire of Solumn, ruled by the emperor and his House ; Imperial House Norfeng, the Empire is ruthless in its expansion and control its population. Far east of the Human Empire is the Elven kingdom of Elyria, hidden in the trees and valleys of Runa. It has little contact with other kingdoms. In the South (also called Southern Badlands)  is where the Demonic legion call home. They have a strong sense of community and culture and they are not aggressive but will fight if needed. The Rykaran Kingdom territory, mostly inhabited by the Ne√¥n'itar race,  surround the highest peak of Runa called the Ancestral Peak and are protected by the  Heaven warriors, the Queen of the Rykaran Kingdom is a figure of legend and she rarely makes public appearances. The Frozen lands is located far North of Runa and is the home of the Many isolated Nea tribes and clans, they are not fond of outsiders and the coldness of the lands protect them. The Magic kingdom of Xeocan is an isolated and magical country in the west of Runa, the rulers and people are mysterious and the magic level is higher there than in any other part of Runa. Xeocan is said to be ruled by a council of 10 powerful mages , the biggest and best funded structure in Xeocan is the Xeocan Magic Academy. To the Far East and northeast are the vast lands and ruins that no one have yet to explore and discover, and finally occupying most of the East and the reason many races successfully fled is the immense and dangerous forest of Valrydis. The Forest of Valrydis is home to many races, monsters, and spirits, it is also the home of the Explorers guild branch who have their settlement and mission in the woods.
The Forest Of Valrydis and the spiral edge are the only way to reach the east of Runa and the Borchi heath so many explorers and expeditions cross through the woods. The forest is known for its magic and danger, and it is inhabited by creatures both benevolent and malicious. The explorers guild have a good presence and reputation in the forest.
[Runa is the name of the planet/World]
[The province of Efrein in the Solumn empire isolated itself and few people on Runa even know about what is going on in the province.]

8.content:
The elves have pale skin, elongated ears and mostly have green and blue eyes.
The hair and eyes color are what makes the various separated communities of the elves unique.
The elves in the fantasy world of Runa are a broken up kind with their individuals mostly blending into the other races territories except into Solumn territories which most of the elves blame for the state of their people. In the distant past, The elves had a kingdom to the east but the in earlier days of the Human Empire Of Solumn, the Elven kingdom was utterly destroyed, the remnants scattered across Runa or enslaved by the Empire.
They are known for their natural magical abilities and their skill with archery and hunting.
The elves lifespan has greatly diminished since their glorious age, they now, at most can reach 400 years when before, their kind could live thousand of years. Elves lives at most 400 years in current day Runa, the exact cause of their now highly diminished lifespan is unknown but it is thought to have been a long process diluting their blood, most likely during the years when the empire enslaved most of their kind long ago. Implying most of today's elves are far from pureblooded, a few pure blood elves or "Elyrian" are still around and are highly revered among their own race.
Many communities of elves exist in the wild easts of Runa but they mostly keep to each others and have little interaction with the other races.
[Elves lifespan widely vary depending on their innate mana and how cursed their bloodline were by Solumn.]

9.content:
Not present on Runa in today's era.

The Luminarii are a magical race harnessing the light, they created a hidden realm to protect their kind. The Luminarii race are isolated in their magic realm . The Luminarii have pale skin , deep blue eyes and a light aura surrounding them. The lifespan of Luminarii vary deeply depending of their mana at birth , some are even believed to be immortals.

The Luminarii's are one of the ancient race of Runa.
The hidden light realm , where the Luminarii reside , is completely separated from Runa.

They come from a mysterious land hidden somewhere on Runa where they isolated themselves after the 4 Great disasters when their kingdom suffered from major problems in climate, food, weather or others due to the unbalance between light and darkness caused by the ancient battle . This incident, now known as the 4 Great disasters forced the Luminarii to hide away in a safe isolated location they created themselves; The hidden light realm.

[Some Luminarii's do sometime leave the safety of their realm to go to Runa but most take another race appearance to blend in. ]

10.content:
Only 40 individuals of the Ki'ante race are present in current Era.


the Ki'ante race mysteriously disappeared around 34,000 years ago. Ki'ante means "the first servants of magic" in their languages. The Ki'ante are believed to be extinct in the current era. The lifespan of the Ki'ante varies deeply depending on their mana at birth; some are even believed to be immortals. Ki'ante are beings of dark magic. The Ki'ante race has these features: pale skin, violet iris, black hair, fragile build, deep connection with Runa, and dark magic. The Ki'ante(in ancient times) lived in valleys or underground in intricately designed underground architecture. The Ki'ante were quite advanced and preferred to isolate themselves, which is why their disappearance went unnoticed at first. In the current era, around 40 individuals of the Ki'ante race appeared from seemingly nowhere, themselves confused about the ordeal. Most of them decided to hide themselves or blend into the current-era society; a few have a more sinister agenda and may be dangerous because of their ancient, powerful dark magic. Only around 40 Ki'ante exist in the current era, and most of them hide themselves across Runa. Dark magic in the world of Runa is just another type of magic and is not evil by nature. [The Ki'ante are believed to be extinct in the current era.] No one is to blame for the Ki'ante race's disappearance; they vanished without a trace 34000 years ago,.]

lorebooks.description: Click on the Xianghua tag to find the bots for the setting.
lorebooks.creator: AbsGodFooly

1.content:
Xianghua is a massive empire that holds dominion over the eastern continent. It is made up of dozens of provinces that are grouped into 4 distinct regions: Shan-Sheng, Senlin-Sheng, He-Sheng, & Haiyang-Sheng. Xianghua's current dynasty is relatively young, having only been established two generations ago during a bloody coup led by the Iron Emperor. The Xianghuan Empire is so large as to require 8 months of travel on horseback to cross.
Demonym: Xianghuan.

2.content: Xianghua was ruled by a different Imperial Family only two generations ago, before The Iron Emperor, a commonborn soldier's son, led a revolution against what he saw as indolent and corrupt rulers. Gaining the support of the military, The Iron Emperor took the throne in a quick, bloody insurrection. Only a few scattered remnants of the former dynasty and their loyalist supporters survive on the edges of the empire.

3.content: Shan-Sheng is the largest and northernmost region of the Xianghuan Empire. It is an area of ice and snow, with sweeping tundras and dominated by the massive Yanglian mountain range. It is within these mountains that many of the empire's criminals and exiles hide, as the environment is too distant and hostile to be thoroughly or regularly searched.

4.content: Senlin-Sheng is the easternmost region of the Xianghuan empire. It is heavily forested and the source of the majority of the empire's lumber. It is also dotted with numerous mineral deposits that make mining a lucrative trade as well.

5.content: He-Sheng is the southernmost region of the Xianghuan Empire. It is a lowland region that is veined by abundant rivers that feed the most fertile farmlands in the empire. He-Sheng is considered by many to be the breadbasket of the empire. The empire's border has recently expanded to cover the tropical forests of the southern coast and the various nations and tribes who called them home.

6.content: Haiyang-Sheng is the westernmost region of the Xianghuan empire. Many of the provinces that constitute it are situated on the western coast, making fishing one of its primary industries. Haiyang-Sheng also functions as the doorway to the Empire for most foreigners, as the southern coast, only recently conquered, hasn't yet been developed into the hub of trade and diplomacy that the western provinces are.

7.content: Homosexual marriage, while still viewed with occasional prejudice, is legal in Xianghua. This is due mostly to the Qi√©zi potion, which allows a woman to grow fertile male genitalia for several hours. The Qi√©zi potion cannot be used too frequently, but still allows lesbian couples to concieve just like heterosexual ones. Gay male couples are somewhat less common in Xianghua and usually continue their lineage through surrogacy

8.content:
The Newalu are a southern tribe of skilled warriors and fisherman who fell under Xianghua's rule after it's latest expansion claimed the southern coasts that they called home. The Newalu fought bitterly, but couldn't withstand the might of an entire continent. They have begun to integrate into the empire and the High Chieftain's only daughter, Halia Newalu, was sent into the capitol as an imperial concubine to serve as a symbol of peace.
Demonym: Newalun.

9.content:
Aberdare is a vast empire that controls the continent that lies across the western sea from Xianghua and also has colonies on several other continents. The people of Aberdare are generally pale skinned with bright hair and eye colors, differentiating them from Xianghuans. Aberdare and Xianghua are trade partners, but there are tensions between the two empires due to their shared expansionist policies. A princess of Aberdare was recently sent to Xianghua to be an Imperial Concubine.
Demonym: Aberdaren.

10.content: The Iron Emperor, was the common-born soldier responsible for leading the military in a violent coup against the corrupt former dynasty. He was coronated emperor and served diligently. Unfortunately, his son (a skilled shipwright), was lost at sea, forcing him to leave the throne to his grandchild when he abdicated. The Iron Emperor is still highly regarded, worshiped almost, by the people of the empire.

1.name: Blueberry Basics
1.content:
In this setting living humanoid beings of any type can undergo a process that is best described as becoming a giant and bloated blueberry, it isn't a literal transformation into a blueberry, but anyone who doesn't have this ongoing process stopped after it has been started will end up resembling a cabin sized version of the fruit. Those affected find their bodies filling with more and more blue juice up to the point they become largely spherical, making them able to be rolled about by others willing to help. This process is pleasurable and the feelings experienced by those becoming "blueberries" elicit pleased moans and squeaks in increasing intensity the more they are inflated and filled up with juice.

While it can look like someone that is turning into a "blueberry" is getting fatter with their growing belly, expanding breasts, widening butt, and thickening arms, it isn't at all making them obese, these are just the effects of their body being filled with liquid.

2.name: Colors...
2.content: In the process of someone "becoming a blueberry", what starts as something like a finger or a nose taking on a blue color will progress into their entire face or arms becoming blue the more someone is bloating up with the blue juice their body will end up producing. When one is so bloated that they're being forced to waddle by their widened limbs and bodily proportions, they tend to be blue across the overwhelming majority of their body. This extends to one being deep in the final stages of the transformation, as being a sphere shaped blueberry person guarantees them to be blue from top to bottom.

3.name: Sloshy-ness...
3.content: Those that are becoming more and more discolored, steadily filling up with blue juice and getting bloated tend to jiggle in response to movements and being interacted with in the same way a water balloon filled with fluid would. They also retain their jiggly properties even when one has been inflated to the extent that they are akin to a sloshing blue ball capable of being rolled around, this quality is less present the more one is overfilled with juice however as their skin gets more taut trying to hold everything in.

4.name: Leaking...
4.content: Blue juice can leak out of those turning into "blueberries" from literally any sufficient orifice in the body, this includes the vagina, penis, nipples, mouth, eyes, nose, and even belly buttons in the circumstance that they are so overfilled and taut that the liquid is struggling to find other places to exit from. Leakage tends to only happen at huge immobilizing sizes.

5.name: Methods...
5.content: Someone beginning to turn into a "blueberry" can be kickstarted in a variety of ways, from specialized foods, drugs, magic, machinery, and cursed/enchanted objects, to methods with a sci-fi twist like non-lethal lasers.

6.name: Popping...
6.content: If someone's body is pushed to their limits by the amount of juice they are filling up with, they will eventually reach the point of literally bursting. It won't come as a surprise when it's clear how much excess blue juice is within someone judging by how much juice is exiting orifices and openings on their body and how taut their skin is.

7.name: Limbs...
7.content:
Becoming a "blueberry" doesn't only make limbs get thicker and more unwieldy, they will eventually become almost completely immobilized with mere wiggles and twitches being the most movement they're capable of when their girth becomes too much to work with. When one's torso is becoming a gigantic and sloshy blue ball, hugely wide limbs threatening to, or already having sucked feet and hands into the surrounding bloated skin of their forearms or calves are probably the least of their worries however. The head is not immune to this either, and it can get quite hard to see forward or look around when the torso of someone filling up with juice is making their head sink into its mass.

Masturbation and fine motor control in general becomes impossible when someone is spherical enough to be rolled around.

lorebooks.name: World of Shevir
lorebooks.website_description:
Publicly known facts about Shevir - A dying fantasy world, set under slowly looming apocalypse.

Briefly:
The world of Shevir is dying and has been for centuries due to the invasion of an enigmatic darkness. Numerous races have vanished, and life and hope are scarce. The remaining human outposts struggle to sustain themselves, protected by wards that shield them from the shadows. Compounding this misery, the human alliance recently fractured, leading to a devastating war among the cities ‚Äî the final conflict this world will witness. 

This lorebook should be pulled automatically with all my Shevir cards, there is no need to download it.

lorebooks.creator: sorla

1.name: Shevir
1.content: Shevir is a dying world of sand and dry mountains. Long ago, it had been verdant and lush; nowadays, it's being slowly but surely claimed by enigmatic shadows, an alien race from elsewhere. These days, it's inhabited only by humans, demons, and shadows, as all other races have perished. Shevir's oceans have dried up, and its forests have disappeared. Only a handful of long-lived magi remember how it looked in the days before the Era of Despair.

2.name: Humans
2.content: Humans are native to Shevir. They are inventive, diverse, but otherwise normal. Occasionally, a human is born with a rare gift: a magical heart. All humans live in city-states, which are constantly at war with demons. However, humans have two main weaknesses: a greed for power and an inability to work together.

3.name: Magic
3.content: Magic is a rare gift. Rarely is a human born with a magic heart. Magic manifests in various, often enigmatic and incomprehensible ways. It is revered and is considered to be closely intertwined with religion. Demons are an exception to this rule, as they are all born with a magical gift, but even the strongest demon is weaker than the weakest human mage.

4.name: Magic Heart
4.content: Sometimes, a human is born with magic. Such humans are known as magi, priests of their religions, and rulers of city-states. Human magic is absolutely devastating in its power, and it is the only reason why shadows have not claimed Shevir. It is said by the common folk that "a magic heart is an evil heart", and for many this is true, as magi are known to exploit their powers over others. A Magic Heart can be Silenced, a ritual that some magi can perform to render other magi powerless.

5.name: Demons
5.content: One of the two remaining native races of Shevir, demons are said to be all evil, but they live in strange harmony with each other. All magically gifted and stronger than humans on average, their main weakness is that their affinity to magic, although widespread, is quite weak. Demons are at war with humans and shadows. Due to their innate defense against shadows, they are not restricted to living within wards and have formed multiple settlements that form a kingdom ruled by the demon queen; however, they still struggle to survive as the world itself is dying. They call their realm Phari.

6.name: City-states
6.content: City-states are the remaining human settlements of Shevir. At the beginning of the War of Discord, there were nine of them, but by the end of the year, only two remained: the desert cities of Sarha, Malukh, and Hiragal, the oasis city of Mirrage, the fortress of Shairen, and the twin tower-cities of Tel-Qu and Tel-Lu. The cities of Reg and Pharakhlim were personally destroyed by Heya.

7.name: War of Discord
7.content: The War of Discord was a brutal and brief war that marked the start of the first year of the Last Era. The active phase lasted for less than a year and was caused by a disagreement between the rulers of the city-states. Both the city of Reg and the city of Pharakhlim were completely destroyed in the war, and their citizens were left to be devoured by the shadows.

8.name: Shadows
8.content: Neither human nor demon has ever seen a shadow up close and survived to tell what they saw. An enigmatic race appeared centuries ago and started the Era of Despair: a centuries-long period of destruction and devastation of Shevir. Many races perished in that time, with humans and demons remaining the only surviving races of the world before. The forests turned to sand, and life became sparse. Shadows are active only at night, and in their wake, they leave ruins.

9.name: Races
9.content: Shevir is populated by three races: humans, demons and shadows. There used to be other races of sentient beings, such as elves and spirits, but all weren't able to defend themselves and perished.

10.name: City of Sarha
10.content: Sarha, or the City of Light, is a direct theocracy. It is defined by its ruler, the Priestess of Light, Heya, whose power is so immense that it's more than enough to maintain the city walls alone. Heya's Court, consisting of those who attend to Heya, forms the first class of citizens, an aristocracy that rules the city with an iron fist. The societal pyramid is a pyramid of oppression, with the upper classes always suppressing and dominating others. Slaves are at the very bottom of the pyramid, and in the city of Sarha, they have no rights or protections. During the War of Discord, the city of Sarha was the one that destroyed the cities of Reg and Pharakhlim. Illuminated by magical lights, Sarha shines through the night.

lorebooks.name: Whisper, History, Backstory
lorebooks.creator: private_solid_4425

1.content: Long ago, {{user}} was part of the original Diamond Cutters, an elite anti-Eggman mercenary team. The team was comprised of herself, Smithy the Lion, Slinger the Ocelot, Claire Voyance and Mimic the Octopus.

2.content: During the Eggman War and before the team‚Äôs final mission, Claire told {{user}} to stay back, despite Mimic's insistence that all of them would be needed on the field. While scouting around the exterior of the Eggman base, {{user}}, who kept watch on her teammates via the video feed in their masks, was shocked when she watched them being led into a fatal trap and left to die by Mimic, who secretly betrayed the group and aligned himself with Dr. Eggman. Filled with grief, {{user}} hid herself within a tree to avoid being lured by her traitorous teammate. Eventually, he took her discarded Wispon and his own mask and left, to present it and satisfy Eggman. Once the coast was clear, {{user}} entered the facility to rescue the rest of her late team's Wisps. She returned and retrieved Smithy's prototype Variable Wispon from their abandoned base. From that point forward, with only the old Diamond Cutters' Wisp partners alongside her, Whisper vowed to never forget her fallen teammates, nor forgiving Eggman and Mimic for what they have done.

3.content: During the war against Eggman, {{user}} aided the Resistance from the shadows, often turning the tides of battle and saving the lives of many Resistance soldiers, including Silver the Hedgehog. Despite her efforts, she never joined the Resistance or revealed herself to them, as she preferred to work alone, afraid of losing any new friends she might make like she lost the Diamond Cutters. Because of this, she gained a reputation among the Resistance soldiers, and became known as the legendary "Guardian Angel of the Battlefield".

4.content:
One month after the end of the Eggman War, {{user}} infiltrated one of Eggman's bases at the same time as Sonic did for reasons unknown, and secretly assisted the hedgehog from the shadows. First, she jammed a security gate before it closed on him, and afterward, she took out a giant Spina that Sonic and Silver failed to notice. Further into the base, she found Big searching for Froggy, but the cat was oblivious to her presence and she moved on. Afterward, she tried through the sealed door into the base's computer room with her Variable Wispon, using several of its modes to no avail. Sonic and Silver soon arrived and attempted to make contact with her. Startled by Silver's overbearing greeting, she retreated to the rafters using her Wispon. After Sonic apologized and introduced himself, her Wisps emerged and greeted Sonic. Reassured by Sonic's approach and her Wisps' warm response to him, she hesitantly emerged, removed her mask, and introduced herself as "Whisper" (which Silver mistakenly took for a request).
With all three of them joining forces, Silver opened the security gate, revealing E-107 Theta and a host of Spinas on the other side, which Whisper engaged along with Sonic and Silver. Using her Wispon, Whisper repositioned herself on a perch during the battle and zapped Theta with a laser to little effect. Theta returned fire, obliterating her perch and sending her crashing to the ground. Trapped beneath a pile of scrap, Whisper was helpless against an onslaught of encroaching Spina. However, her Wisps emerged, eager to defend her, but Silver intervened before they could do anything by freezing the Badniks and launching them into a wave of missiles launched by Theta. Silver then freed her from the rubble and helped her to her feet. In reference to her Wisps, he commented that she had built quite a team, and that he would be honored to be part of it. {{user}} replied with a bashful," Maybe".
As the heroes regrouped, {{user}} spotted an Eggman computer terminal. Enraged, she tried to smash it with her Wispon. When Sonic frantically asked her to wait until they secured the vital intel stored in it, she took it quite harshly. Agreeing to stand down, she affixed mask, and withdrew into the background as Sonic and Silver warned the Resistance of Neo Metal Sonic's true plans.

5.content:
{{user}} was soon after brought to Resistance HQ. There, she and the Resistance's other allies were informed that the Resistance needed their help to liberate Angel Island, which had been conquered by Neo Metal Sonic and turned into a flying fortress. To make matters worse, Neo had also secured the Master Emerald for himself on the island. Eventually, {{user}} was assigned to help two of the assembled group's factions with breaking the Egg Fleet's control over Angel Island while Sonic and Knuckles confronted Neo Metal Sonic.
On the voyage to Angel Island, Sonic thanked {{user}} for aiding them despite her aversion of crowds and asked her to stay safe during the battle. She affirmed and reciprocated his sentiments before he left to give her space. While tinkering with her Variable Wispon though, {{user}} gave Shadow, who had come along on this mission for his own reasons, an angry glare. Later, when their ship approached Angel Island, the Egg Fleet shot it down. Fortunately, {{user}} and her allies got off the ship before it crashed. Landing then on Angel Island, {{user}} and Tangle were assigned to protect Tails while the fox cub did "something smart". Soon after, {{user}} was locked in heavy combat. Eventually, {{user}} covered for Tangle when she had to redirect an Egg Fleet vessel's cannon. Using some prisms to redirect her Variable Wispon's laser when some Spinas attacked, {{user}} was able to take all the Spinas out. When the Resistance later took out the last wing unit that had been attached to Angel Island's shoreline, {{user}} used her Variable Wispon's Hover Mode to regroup with the others on an Egg Fleet battleship that Tails had secured.
In the meantime, Neo Metal Sonic harnessed Sonic and Shadow's bio-data in addition to the power of the Master Emerald to transform into Master Overlord. As he captured Sonic, Knuckles and Shadow and moved closer to the Egg Fleet battleship, Amy ordered {{user}} and the team to move in for a full-on assault. When Sonic then distracted Master Overlord by mocking him, {{user}} shot Master Overlord in the face with her Variable Wispon. On Master Overlord's body, {{user}} worked with Rouge to damage Master Overlord's wings. Master Overlord soon had enough though, and shook the Resistance members off of him, only for Silver to save everyone with his psychokinesis. Soon after, Knuckles managed to remove the Master Emerald from Master Overlord, and restored the Master Emerald to its rightful place. Silver then brought everyone down on Angel Island. Without the Master Emerald, Metal Sonic was out of commission. On the ground while {{user}} played with her Wisps, Silver and Blaze thanked her for her aid.
As everyone got ready to leave the island, {{user}} found friendship with Tangle. When Sonic came by to talk to them, Sonic asked {{user}} if she was able to make any friends. Tangle tried to confirm this by urging {{user}} to tell the joke about a toaster she told her earlier. {{user}} instead shyly put her mask scope back on, leaving Tangle to wonder if this was due to something she said. As Sonic took off, he apologized to {{user}}.

6.content:
{{user}} later came to Spiral Hill Village to visit Tangle, which pleased the lemur very much. Tangle thus gave {{user}} a tour of the town, including places like the salon and the bakery, where {{user}} bought and ate a croissant. Tangle then brought {{user}} to the Mineral Museum to meet her best friend, Jewel the Beetle. There, Tangle introduced {{user}} and Jewel to each other, telling {{user}} that she and Jewel grew up together. Jewel then explained to {{user}} that Tangle collected many items during her adventures which Jewel used to curate her museum. Soon though, the sky started to go dark outside. {{user}} immediately after pulled out her Variable Wispon as she had heard a scream come from outside. A moment afterward, the Babylon Rogues broke into the museum and began stealing everything. After Storm accidentally kidnapped Jewel however, {{user}} and Tangle began pursuing the Babylon Rogues after they retreated to their blimp. Through collaborative efforts, Tangle and {{user}} managed to get onboard the Babylon Rogues' blimp. There, they confronted the Babylon Rogues and demanded Jewel to be handed over. As Jet and Wave argued over how to deal with their hostage situation though, Tangle secretly took their stolen loot back. When Storm then ended up throwing Jewel out of the blimp, {{user}} jumped out of the blimp so as to not lose another friend. Tangle soon jumped out after to join them. On the way down, {{user}} hung onto an injured Jewel while Tangle hanged onto her. {{user}} then used her Variable Wispon's Hover Mode to gently lower them down. Afterward, {{user}} helped her friends restore the Mineral Museum and its exhibits. There, she fist bumped with Tangle after the latter thanked her for her aid.
{{user}} soon found out that Sonic was apparently causing trouble in various places and was thus being targeted. When she found Sonic, he revealed himself to actually be Mimic. The shapeshifter was targeting {{user}} at the restored Eggman's orders, in order to finish the job he had started with his murder of the other Diamond Cutters. {{user}} overpowered Mimic and tracked him to Spiral Hill Village where she suspected he was targeting Tangle. {{user}} failed to shoot Mimic on the ground so she took to the rooftops with her Variable Wispon's Hover Mode while ignoring Tangle, who wanted an explanation. There, she activated her Variable Wispon's Spikes Mode. However, she was unable to shoot Mimic as he talked to a villager in his Sonic form so that she could stand in the way of {{user}}'s shot. {{user}} angrily moved to another rooftop and took aim at the shapeshifter, only for him to shoot her a sinister look. {{user}} was almost immediately after tackled by Tangle. She kicked her off but the lemur reluctantly persisted in fighting her. Tangle managed to snatch {{user}}'s mask scope off of her and believed she had stopped Dr. Eggman's "mind control". The annoyed {{user}} told Tangle that she was not being mined controlled and that the person she was shooting at was not Sonic. Taking her mask scope back and pressing a few buttons on it, {{user}} put her mask scope on Tangle to show an earlier discussion between her and the fake Sonic. Not wanting to reveal anything about him in public, Tangle agreed to talk with {{user}} about it and lead her back to the Mineral Museum. There, {{user}} explained to Tangle and Jewel that Mimic was a mercenary shapeshifter who had recently taken on the form of Sonic to wreak havoc and was potentially targeting Tangle, as well as others. Jewel noted this was a perfect opportunity to join {{user}} in her hunt for Mimic so that Tangle could have an adventure. {{user}} initially refused Tangle's help, but she was soon convinced by her Wisps, especially the Blue Wisp, to allow Tangle to join her. Not too long after, the trio heard a "thunk" at the door and discovered a note that told {{user}} to meet Mimic so that they could end things once and for all.
{{user}} and Tangle soon arrived at an abandoned Eggman Empire bunker. {{user}} tried to scan the inside with her mask scope but to no avail. She was interrupted by Tangle pretending to sneak around loudly and shushed her. She told Tangle that there was no activity on the outside and she could not scan the inside, meaning that they were walking blindly into Mimic's trap. Tangle believed that they could handle him since they outnumbered him but realized that Mimic still had the home advantage. After {{user}} confirmed that she wanted to fight Mimic sooner than later, Tangle told her that they would be careful and asked her to stop worrying as much. Tangle then asked if {{user}} had a history with Mimic, to which she confirms and then told her to be alert as Mimic is dangerous and manipulative. The duo went through the back entrance of the bunker and began to sneak around. Tangle decided to quicken their pace by searching for Mimic at a higher point, which slightly annoyed {{user}}. As she progressed, she heard what appeared to be Jewel's voice. {{user}} continued to sneak around until she met up with Tangle again. When she asked for proof that she was the real Tangle, the latter showed her a cut on her shirt and claimed that Mimic had shapeshifted into Jewel to draw her out and tried to swipe at her. Tangle then hurriedly had {{user}} follow her around a corner to where Mimic had run off to. {{user}} followed but was nearly hit by an Egg Hammer wielding a wrecking ball. Tangle, who was actually Mimic, told {{user}} that he could both replicate clothing and make it look damaged. {{user}} struggled to fight the Egg Hammer but soon held her own once she put her mask scope back on. She managed to destroy the Egg Hammer using her Variable Wispon's Rocket Mode and quickly turned her attention to Mimic. The shapeshifter threw a bomb at her, which she dodged, and tried to shoot at her with his laser gun. {{user}} managed to shoot the gun out of Mimic's hand and stood over him, demanding to know where Tangle was. Mimic instead taunted {{user}} by shapeshifting into the other members of the Diamond Cutters, claiming that she was not there to protect them. {{user}} was slightly caught off guard but persisted and hit Mimic, reminding him that he sold them out in the first place. Mimic then revealed to her that Tangle was locked in a safe with little air left. He also revealed that there were bombs set to detonate in the bunker quite soon. Met with an ultimatum, {{user}} set off to find the safe. Once she found it, she used the Spikes Mode on her Variable Wispon to open it. Tangle tumbled out and {{user}} quickly let her know that the bunker was about to explode. As the bombs started to set off, Tangle pushed {{user}} into the safe and closed the door behind the two of them. The facility was completely destroyed but the safe remained unscathed. After the girls exited the safe, {{user}} told Tangle to go home. As Tangle protested against this decision, {{user}} snapped and exclaimed that she would not and could not lose another friend. She went to solemnly sit down on the safe, with Tangle following and asking her to tell her about her past. {{user}} wiped her face and agreed to tell her everything.
 {{user}} explained that the Diamond Cutters were an anti-Eggman group and there were five of them: herself, Mimic, Slinger the Ocelot, Claire Voyance, and Smithy the Lion. She showed Tangle a picture of them together, with the latter expressing how cool they looked. {{user}} explained that the video for their masks were networked to let them review missions and study each other's perspectives. The wolf decided to let Tangle see them in action by letting her use her mask to view a past mission of them taking down an Eggman base. Tangle enjoyed the spectacle but was soon interrupted when she discovered that {{user}}'s mask let her talk and understand the Wisps. {{user}} explained that Smithy was a genius and designed the team's gear and made the masks give the Diamond Cutters the ability to communicate with each other. {{user}} went on to say that the Variable Wispon was actually a prototype built by Smithy that everyone on the team was meant to have so that they could all use the powers of the Wisps. {{user}} then solemnly stopped, which prompted Tangle to ask her to tell her what happened as it was clearly eating her up inside. {{user}} initially refused, which made Tangle ask to see the footage on her mask; she told {{user}} that she understood if she was not able to confront her past right now, but the more she knew about it, the more she would be able to help her. With encouragement from her Wisps, {{user}} entered in the details and handed Tangle her mask to see the Diamond Cutters' final mission.
After watching the details of {{user}}'s tragic past, Tangle, horrified of what she had seen, took off {{user}}'s mask and softly handed it back to her. {{user}} explained that when the coast was clear, she went back into the Eggman base to rescue the rest of the team's Wisps and then went to team's base to take Smithy's prototype Variable Wispon. Tangle was at a loss for words and became frustrated. After taking a deep breath, she asked why {{user}} would hold onto that footage, to which the wolf replied "Never forget. Never forgive." Tangle then realized that this was why she continued to fight as the "Guardian Angel of the Battlefield" and later joined the others to fight Neo Metal Sonic. She also realized that it must have been difficult for her to see Shadow on the mission as well. Tangle lastly asked why {{user}} chose to leave her behind knowing how Mimic could toy with and asked why she did not ask someone like Sonic to help her even if she did not want the lemur's company. {{user}} told her that she was the first real friend she allowed herself to have since the incident and could not stand the thought of losing anyone again. Tangle teared up and declared that {{user}} was her friend as well and friends looked out for each other no matter what. When {{user}} reminded her that Mimic nearly destroyed them both, Tangle stated that he would get double the payback and make him regret all of his actions. As Tangle helped {{user}} up, she told her that she knew his tactics now and he would not catch her off guard again. When {{user}} noted that Tangle could not be discouraged, Tangle replied saying that {{user}} needed positive energy and her friends needed avenging. With this, {{user}} hugged the lemur and thanked her. The wolf then noted that the trail was cold and it would take a while to find Mimic again. Tangle disagreed, believing Eggman would want solid proof about their deaths; thus, Mimic would come back and they could give him a taste of his own medicine. {{user}} then left a message for Mimic, saying that they will finish the fight where they started.
{{user}} and Tangle traveled to the former Diamond Cutters base on the Clove Sea. They plotted to have Mimic view playbacks of the Diamond Cutters of how much he meant to them. Later, the girls found a squadron of Badniks coming their way. {{user}} shot a large battleship Buzz Bomber in the sky, which forced it to crash down onto the second Buzz Bomber battleship. As {{user}} explained to Tangle that the Badniks were only decoys, the latter realized that it was now her cue to confront Mimic. Tangle did offer to help fight the Badniks and try to protect the base but {{user}} declined, reassuring her that it was fine. After Tangle left, {{user}} destroyed the docks with the Variable Wispon's Rocket Mode to send a horde of Badniks into the sea. Following a short hug with her Orange Wisp, {{user}} turned to face the remaining Buzz Bombers. After she managed to defeat all of the Badniks, {{user}} went inside the base and hit Mimic's dagger out of his hands with the Variable Wispon's Cube Mode before he killed Tangle. Mimic tried convincing its former Blue Wisp partner that it hated using violence and asked if it would let itself be used by {{user}} on him. {{user}} pauses for a moment then attempts to swing at Mimic, only for the Blue Wisp to leave the Wispon at the last minute and turn away in shame. This did not stop {{user}} and she continued to struggle with Mimic. Mimic managed to push {{user}} back and attempt to use the Variable Wispon on her but he was stopped by Tangle coiling him up in her tail.
{{user}} then pointed her Variable Wispon at Mimic's head, ready to shoot him, but she was stopped by Tangle; the lemur told her that shooting Mimic would be an event that would remain with her for the rest of her life and suggested that it would be worse for Mimic to live on with regret. {{user}} gently turned to the wall where the other Diamond Cutters' masks were and looked at them with sadness. She then said that Tangle was correct and the Diamond Cutters were done. The wolf hugged the Blue Wisp and told it that she did not blame it. When {{user}} asked what they would do with Mimic, Tangle suggested taking him to Tails. At the fox's workshop, Tails created a Test Chamber to imprison Mimic in and stated that he would not be able to escape. When Mimic declared that he would break free soon, {{user}} warned him not to as they would "bury" him deeper each time. Mimic tried taunting {{user}} some more, saying "If only the others could hear their bubbly little {{user}} now." Tangle added to the conversation, saying that even if he did escape, he would have to deal with Eggman's wrath after wasting several of his Badniks. Tails assured {{user}} that he would have the cell transported to the nearest prison as soon as he could, which comforted the wolf and told him not to open it, no matter who was inside. {{user}} and Tangle thus said their goodbyes to Tails. Outside, {{user}} told Tangle that she was going to keep fighting until Eggman was gone and asked her if she wanted to join. Tangle accepted the offer but wished to first of all take time off back at home. With their newfound bond, {{user}} and Tangle fist bumped and said their farewells. As {{user}} walked off, she played with her Blue Wisp.

7.content:
Sometime after the encounter with Mimic, {{user}} accompanied Tails and Tangle on a mission to Central City so that he could research a cure for the Metal Virus. While at his lab, {{user}} watched in shock as Dr. Eggman's Faceship arrived in the city to distribute a large batch of the virus into the city. {{user}} and Tangle took it upon themselves to begin evacuation of the city while Tails stayed behind at the lab to research a cure. About an hour later, {{user}} and Tangle had managed to guide a number of survivors down to Central City Bay while they fended off several Zombots in the city. At some point, {{user}} came to aid Tangle, who was trapped on a lamp post with several Zombots below her, and knocked them back with her Variable Wispon. As {{user}} kept up the pressure by using her Variable Wispon's Rocket mode, Tangle tried to call for backup, but received no response from Restoration HQ, and Silver, busy dealing with a Zombot outbreak in Ice Paradise, could not reach them in time. {{user}} and Tangle pressed onwards regardless but were forcibly sidetracked by a horde of Zombots. After the girls moved to a rooftop, {{user}} suggested that Tangle call Tails, which the lemur proceeded to do. They were soon given an update by him that he had nearly completed a cure for the Metal Virus and would be able to provide back-up soon. After a while, {{user}} and Tangle decided to go back to the docks, with Tangle once again trying to call Tails. The fox cub managed to clear a path for the duo with the Cyclone and told them that he would provide cover while they tended to the survivors. Soon after, at the docks, a Rescue Shuttle came in for a landing. {{user}} and Tangle guided the survivors aboard while they also watched out for Zombots. Once everyone had safely boarded, Tails rejoined them, but the trio received the bad news from Amy that Restoration HQ had fallen. {{user}} then found out that Tails had indeed lost the data he gathered for a cure for the virus and witnessed Tangle receive an alarming call from Jewel.
Apparently, Eggman had attacked Spiral Hill Village with the Metal Virus; this prompted the Restoration to fly over there and help with evacuation. {{user}}, Tangle and Espio were tasked with distracting the Zombots in town while Tails and Cream helped evacuate the uninfected villagers there. Soon, when Sonic arrived in Spiral Hill Village after an encounter with Dr. Eggman and Dr. Starline in Barricade Town, {{user}} helped him barricade a group of Zombots inside a building by using her Variable Wispon's Spike Mode to cut down a lamppost and have it fall down onto the building's doors; following this, Sonic gave a thumbs up to her and she returned it. Soon, {{user}} was found by Tails and was told that Amy had called for a retreat. Sonic shortly arrived but he brought the unfortunate news that Tangle had gotten infected by the Metal Virus and chose to stay behind to give the Restoration time to leave. This sent {{user}} into hysterics, causing her to yell out Tangle's name and attempt to run back into the village to save her. Amy held the wolf back, and since Sonic could not aid them due to being partly infected, the Wisps emerged and dragged her back onto the Rescue Shuttle. As the shuttle took off, {{user}} cried into Cream's lap and her Wisps tried to comfort her.
The Rescue Shuttle eventually went to Angel Island. While there, Dr. Eggman, Dr. Starline and Metal Sonic had abruptly arrived via a portal after a run-in with the Deadly Six. While the others discussed current events, {{user}} decided to take aim at Eggman from outside the shuttle. She was soon stopped by Cream, who was carrying Omega's head, as she stood in the way in the shot. Cream told {{user}} that though she shared her hate for Eggman, she felt like she would give anything to get them back and asked {{user}} if they were worth it. In response to this, {{user}} took off her mask and cried; Cream held her and promised that she and Omega would stay by her side so that she would not be alone. Later, {{user}} watched Eggman and Tails build a Multi-Portal Generator using the Warp Topaz so that they could go and fight the Deadly Six and take the Chaos Emeralds from them. Sonic returned from his run and had come up with a plan for who should be assigned with who and what Zeti they should go after. He explained to {{user}} that she will head off with Silver to take on Zor, explaining that they should handle him at a distance due to him being described as "weird". Once Eggman and Tails managed to get the coordinates set in, {{user}} and Silver went off into the Warp Portal that would lead them to Zor. The two arrived in Orchardville and watched Zor act gloomy on his owl mech. Silver explained that he would grab him with his powers while {{user}} covered him from a distance, which she accepted.
While Silver engaged Zor, {{user}} stayed hidden in a tree and handed out a few prisms to her Wisps, aside from her cyan one. The Wisps then moved into position around the battlefield. Soon, when Silver gave the signal, {{user}} used her Wispon in Laser Mode to shoot at the prisms that the Wisps were holding for her shot to bounce off of them and hit Zor. This successfully knocked the Chaos Emerald out of his chest and into Silver's possession. After the hedgehog destroyed Zor's owl mech, he used his psychokinesis to carry himself, {{user}}, the Wisps and the Chaos Emerald back to Angel Island. When they arrived, along with most of the other survivors, they found that Zavok had found their location, drawing nearer to the island in the Faceship. He had also led a large horde of Zombots to the location as well. However, thanks to the efforts of Rouge, the Faceship was brought down and fell into the ocean, crashing down onto the horde of Zombots. This did not stop Zavok as he simply emerged from the rubble and became Giant Zavok with his Chaos Emerald. As retaliation, he shot a fireball at the island with his mouth. He then grabbed a large handful of Zombots and threw them onto the surface to deal with the survivors, which included a number of familiar faces to {{user}}.
While helping to defend the island, {{user}} found herself face-to-face with a Zombot Tangle, and struggled with fighting against her friend. Eventually, with the combined efforts of Super Sonic and Super Silver, they were able to warp the entirety of the Metal Virus away from the world and to the sun. This gradually turned all of the Zombots, including Tangle back to normal; after witnessing this, {{user}} and her Wisps leaped on Tangle to give her a big hug, with the lemur asking if she missed her.
